Mud         : Elendor
Code Base   : [MUSH] PennMUSH (heavily modified)
Telnet      : mush.elendor.net 1892 [134.114.66.33]
WWW         : http://www.elendor.net/
Description :

   Founded in 1991, Elendor is the premiere J.R.R. Tolkien based world with
3000+ users and 5500+ rooms. Set between the times of The Hobbit and The
Lord of the Rings, Elendor is devoted to providing a quality roleplaying
environment where activity is primarily social and interactive rather than
automated. On Elendor, players may take on a character from any of 5 diff-
erent races and 22 different cultures of Middle-earth, each of which has a
dedicated staff of players ready to help you learn the game and how to
play. The staff on Elendor is especially helpful and friendly to players
who are new to Tolkien and/or to MUSHing in general.

   The roleplaying environment on Elendor consists of a beautiful and acc-
urate representation of Tolkien's land of Middle-earth where room descrip-
tions change dynamically with the time of day, seasons, and weather. Elen-
dor has an extensive global command system which includes a finely-tuned
skill/stat-based combat system, a full economic system with several forms
of currency, an elaborate language system with support for 19 different
spoken and written Tolkien languages, and a convenient wardrobe system
with which you can create a detailed collection of descriptions for your
character. Elendor also provides a custom designed chat system with over
100 channels and its own mailer system equipped with over 100 bulletin
boards where players plan game activities and discuss Tolkien's writing.

Mud         : Elephant Mud

Telnet      : elephant.org 23 [194.74.208.195]
WWW         : http://www.elephant.org/
Description :

  Elephant Mud is one of the older, larger and more advanced 
muds out on the net today, with a wealth of experience
behind it. Offering a wealth of features not found on
its competitors, it brings totally unique guilds, noble
Houses, sophisticated multi-classing, bloodlines, stamina,
player run newspapers, exploration rewards, and much much 
more to an arena awash with 'stock' alternatives.

Elephant Mud allows PK, but it is socially controlled. The
town Council can bounty, fine, jail and execute people
for breaking the law. Laws are both set and enforced by
players and Council have sophisticated investigative tools
as their disposal. A clever criminal still has a chance
of course, and the fight between law and chaos goes on
eternally.

The mud is set in a medieval/dark ages world, where 
magic, not science, is the key area of research. Humans,
Dwarves, Elves and many other races rub shoulders and
work with (and against) each other to defend, or bring
down the town of Drakenwood and its environs. It is a 
dangerous world, but a world equally of great rewards,
and truely has something for everyone.

Elephant Mud has 3000-4000 regular players, many of which
have been playing for in excess of 5 years with a notable
number who have been here for 7, 8, 9 or even 10 years.
With longevity like that we invite you to come and find
out for yourself what all the fuss is about. Who knows,
you may even decide to stay!

* Clanskills, autocasting and special items, revolutionary original skills allowing for 
  resourceful and various PK
* Over 600 spells/skills and growing

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Eltanin Resurrection
Code Base   : Gamma Diku / Eltanin
Telnet      : celemir.net 3000 [204.251.180.191]
WWW         : None
Description :

One of the earlier Diku games on the 'net was Eltanin.

Unfortunately, it met an untimely demise many years ago.

Eltanin Resurrection is old Eltanin's code, and will be running
without modification indefinately.  If you want to examine a
vintage Gamma based Diku (or were a previous player), drop on by.

Players that can prove they played the original Eltanin will have
levels reimbursed.

Features (vintage 1991-1992!):
30 levels, 8 classes.  (Mu/Cl/Th/Wa/Bard/Monk/Archer/Psionicist)
Semi randomly loading useful potions/scrolls!
Must use a scroll to recall!
An early mount system!
Limited equipment!  PK for it!  and more!  (or not)

However, perspective players should be warned.  This MUD is
harder than a typical 1999 era MUD.

pestilence.

attacks upon other cities so that you may bring them under your Emperor's 
command! If land battles aren't your thing, the navy offers you the chance 
to secure your naval superiority over the other nations, through boarding 
or sinking enemy vessels!  Whatever path you choose for your character, 
Elysium will provide you with the depth and realism required for the 
ultimate in roleplaying!

Mud         : Empire
Code Base   : [Dikumud] Diku (modified gamma)
Telnet      : wraith.aplus.net 4000 [216.55.144.9]
WWW         : http://empire.aplus.net/
Description :

  Empire was created over 7 years ago, and has grown steadily ever since. This
immense, all-original world began as a diku mud, but has since transgressed into
something much more enjoyable.  A multi-continental world connected by ships and
dragonflight forms an epic world with a large and long history.

  A system of introductions allows anonymous playing where others only see your
descriptions rather than names unless you wish otherwise.  This along with a
magic system that uses memorization instead of mana, learn by use instead of
practicing, skill based intensity of spells rather than lost concentrations,
along with years of other modifications and you've got something unique.

  We support the usual multiple coin types, bankers, colors, etc. that go with
most muds.  Empires interface is dominated more by words rather than numbers and
this adds to the role playing context.

Give this mud a shot and you'll be listing it amongst your favorites for years.

Telnet      : legacy.kyndig.com 3000 [209.61.155.105]
WWW         : http://legacy.kyndig.com/
Description :

   The 8 classes and 10 races of The Age of Legacy offer diversity without confusion, 
the fact that balance was a priority is obvious to anybody who plays the 
game.  The 91 level, unique remort system allows you to be reborn when you 
weary of your current life, each life you find yourselves with different 
strengths and weaknesses, talents and gifts, but sometimes also handicaps.  
However, from life to life your strength and knowledge inevitably increases.  
Leveling, questing, roleplaying, and pking ... even chatting, you can pick 
and choose which you would like to do, all are encouraged, none are 
mandatory, so that everybody can find what they like to do, and not have to 
do what they hate.  The new evolvable spells and skills system allows you to 
rediscover new ways to use existing skills, and watch their power increase.  
Custom clans can wage battles with each other, pit strategies and perserverance 
against each other, and destroy their most hated enemies by ravaging the opposite 
side.  

   The Age of Legacy is filled with adventure, be it in going off on grand quests, 
creating and maintaining your own clan, battling scores of monsters, searching 
for treasures to strengthen your power, or challenging other players to a duel 
of skill, wits, and blades.  Whatever you are looking for, you will find it at The 
Age of Legacy.  Venture in for a taste, you won't regret it.

Mud         : EntertainMUCK
Code Base   : daemonMUCK 0.14 + patches + custom code
Telnet      : game.emuck.com 6903
WWW         : http://www.emuck.com/
Description :

   EntertainMUCK, or EMuck for short, is a socially oriented game derived
from daemonMUCK source code and has been extensively modified.  EMuck
was designed in 1995, and opened its doors early in 1996.  It was
originally housed on a system at the University of Minneapolis.  In
1997, the system moved to its present location in New Hampshire.  The
original builders and coders on EMuck were Disney fans, and there is a
lot of Disney-themed building located throughout the game.  Our
charter is not limited to Disney, however, but rather to the general
topic of entertainment (anime, movies, games, etc.).  We have nightly
chats scheduled every day, the topics of which are determined usually
by daily events.  We also have moderated chats as well, featuring VIP
guests, which in the past have included book authors, movie and
Broadway actors and actresses, voice artists, producers and more!  Our
game admins use 'normal' player characters for most day to day use, so
everybody is an equal.  Access is free for everybody.  For more
information, please visit our web site or simply come online as a
guest.  We hope you come visit us at EntertainMUCK -- Where YOU are
the Star!

WWW         : http://www.darkprophets.com/
Description :

  On the south coast of Estria, between T'shombe Forest and the Great Ocean,
rests the island city state of Anaj Naiesta. From the islands of Dhynara, in
the east, come ships bearing spices and other wares. These diametrically
differing cultures render Anaj Naiesta a place of unsurpassed diversity. It
is  in this city that we set the scene.
 
Dark Prophets MUSH is a game focusing on quality role-play in an interesting
environment. The theme is original, a tale of generic fantasy juxtaposed
with an Arabian Nights style culture, and features despotic prophets, brave
warriors, independent artists and wise sages. The game deals with the
eternal struggle between the light and the dark, between what is right and
what is wrong.
 
It should be noted that DarkProphets does NOT employ a combat system, an
econ system, or even a magic system. This is an RP by consent mush, where we
believe that through a minimal amount of code we can achieve a better
quality of free-form rp.
 
That said, player backgrounds are encouraged after a player has been with us
for a few weeks, and code does exist for taking care of that.
 
(Mailing List: darkprophets@yahoogroups.com )

individual character can make a substantial impact.  We count
among our community many dedicated roleplayers, with years of

  We run on a heavily modified version of the SMAUG codebase,
known as SERF : a Simulated Environment for Roleplay and Fantasy.
We support a wide variety of features that offer players greater
options and a more interactive environment, and we continue to
refine our code, even after a seven-year history.

  We offer an RPAWARD system that allows players to distribute RPP 
(roleplay points) to one another, for their roleplaying and also
allowing then to gain levels via RPP.

  So if you are interested in enjoying a serious roleplaying
experience, consider joining our close-knit community, become
a part of the Eternal Struggle, the Home of in-depth roleplay.

 We've been around for some time now.  DBStar is a mud where
we emphasise having fun: There is a strong roleplay streak
running through the mud that links with a 'fallout' style 
perks system, and a jobs system that is reminiscent of Final
Fantasy games. A ship system, Housing systems, an extended stats
system, hiscore boards, customized equipment, a dragonball wish
system, extensive race and skill options, a skill capsule system
akin to 'Dragonball Z : Budokai', rewards for dogged players,
over 180 skills split between over 10 races, unique abilities
like bodyswap, egg laying and genocide attack, poll and voting 
systems, and a unique 'train' command.

  There is no limit to player statistics, with technically
infinite hitpoints and kipoints available, and players can
indulge in side-missions, roleplaying, item hunting, and more
real-life tasks, such as fishing, and creating their own items.
Roleplay is automatically rewarded by the MUD, and the points
gained can be used in a number of ways - Including Fusion. Points
earned from completing missions goes towards jobs, or small
rewards, like power increases or items.

  Now on a new, lag-free server with 100% uptime, we guarantee that
playing DBStar will be one of the best things you've ever done!

Mud         : Fallen Night
Code Base   : [LP] Modified original Twlib
Telnet      : mud.crazyeddies.net 5150 [69.14.169.62]
WWW         : None
Description :

  Welcome to the realm of Fallen Night. Fallen Night provides an environment
containing monsters, dragons, witches, warlocks, dungeons, and caves. It is
a virtual world in which you create a character of your desire and ex plore
the lands that behold you with adventure and challenge. Fallen Night is an
LP Mud (Multi- User Dungeon) where people from all over the real world can
come together and play in a role-playing environment. Every person has the
freedom to play their character however they want.
 
Role playing is encouraged on Fallen Night, and adds to one's mudding
experience. There are quests and challenges that lie in the domain that
sometimes require the assistance of another player or possibly one of the
immortal beings that oversee their progress. The friendly staff environment
also allows for people to chat with friends and wander around the
environment. This type of behavior is not discouraged and is usually welcome
as long as it does not disturb other players involved in other things.
 
I welcome you to play on my mud, and I am looking forward to seeing you
online. To play on Fallen Night, use your telnet software and connect to
mud.crazyeddies.net port 5150

Mud         : DragonStone
Code Base   : [EOS] Highly Modified from EoS
Telnet      : Dragonstone.org 1234 [207.44.142.105]
WWW         : http://www.dragonstone.org/
Description :

 Throughout the towns of Prexion, Aden, and Einar, many 
tales have been told of the legend of the DragonStone. Most
believe the stories are that of a fool's imagination. Few, 
though, dare to venture beyond the towns to seek the 
truth..... Are YOU one of these? 

The Legend tells of a great Golden Dragon called Corin-Mur, 
who holds the stone within its lair. It is said that the 
stone holds the key to immortality.

Choose from 16 races and 14 classes. Multiclass if you 
desire. Breathe life into whatever you create.

There are many great tasks and quests to complete in your 
search for the DragonStone. You must seek the aid of 
others; alone, you are sure to fail. Join one of the clans, 
or seek help from the friends you will make.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Dreamers
Code Base   : TMI-2
Telnet      : cal006031.student.utwente.nl 1998 [130.89.227.75]
WWW         : None
Description :

   Dreamers has been in the development stage for nearly 
a year, and is now open for playing, though things are 
still a bit rough around the edges.  The theme is Fantasy,
with surrealism and creativity strongly encouraged.  We 
have no policies on role play, and would like people to 
play the game in the manner that they enjoy the most.  We 
are interested in hiring coders, either experienced coders, 
or inexperienced folks with a creative turn of mind and good 
verbal skills.  

Our race selection is a bit unusual in that new players can 
choose to merge two races to obtain some characteristics of 
each, and some limbs of each.  It's a bit random, so unusual
physical characteristics are easily attained.  With five 
different races to choose from, there are 25 possible 
combinations.

The classes will be entirely run by players, once they are 
approved, and the people proposing a new class can select 
the government, recruitment policy, primary and secondary 
stats, name, and defining characteristics of that class.

Mud         : Everdark
Code Base   : [LP] lpmud
Telnet      : everdark.org 3000 [199.184.188.18]
WWW         : http://www.everdark.org/
Description :

Everdark features:

 * 9 guilds: Fighter, Mage, Cleric, Rogue, Illusionist,
   Undead, Druid, Bard, and Ranger - Lycanthrope guild is
   in the works.
 * An excellent level/stat advancement system:
   30 levels, 6 completely customizable stats.
 * 16 challenging mental- and physical-based quests with
   new ones in development at all times
 * A complex nobility that offers advancement past simple
   level increases that has been developed for more than 3
   years since the mud started
 * An optional playerkilling system for those interested
 * A core group of dedicated and hard-working wizards that
   concentrate on quality, meaning extraordinairily thorough
   levels of detail
 * Much, much, more! (Did you expect me to leave that out?)

based soley on TSR's D&D 3rd Edition and Forgotten Realms.
RP will be a big part, as will PK and all other aspects
that can be added into the game.  Item creation,
collection of commodities, secondary skills (fishing,
farming, mining, weaponsmith, etc). 

Everything will be forth coming. Future Players and Staff
that log in the mud are always greeted (when someone is
on) and asked what could be added while we're still in the
developement stages.  We will hopefully be opening later
in summer of 2004 for stage 1.

Mud         : WoDSpace
Code Base   : [MUX] MUX 2.4.0.12 #1 [ALPHA]
Telnet      : frostmud.dyndns.org 8251 [67.32.222.236]
WWW         : None
Description :

 WoDSpace. What happens when humanity advances and takes to the stars? Vampires are
deprived of sustenance, so must follow. The  Fae and Magi are offered new worlds to
explore. The Shifters need to follow their foes if the Wyrm is to be defeated. Even Demons
spread out to find new lands to make their own, people to corrupt, or save dependent upon
their bent.
 
 WoDSpace is a departure from what's out there. We're working on getting an HSpace port
to actually work, so ships and ship combat will be supported in the future. Multiple
worlds are already in the works, but more is needed! We need coders to build the code to
work with SGP's cgen, among other things. Builders interested in worlds of their own. The
Goddess is on most of the time, so if you want to check us out and ask questions, feel
free.

Mud         : Sherwood MUCK
Code Base   : [MUCK] Fuzzball
Telnet      : sherwood.muck.limitless.org 1996 [206.63.100.83]
WWW         : http://members.limitless.org/~sherwood/
Description :

A MUCK for people who like dramatic role playing in a medieval
environment, Sherwood MUCK strives to capture a whimsical but dark spirit by
casting anthropomorphic animals in the roles of 13th century peasants,
nobles and outlaws. Dispensing with magic and mythological creatures, this
MUCK concentrates on realistic role play with realistic consequences. Not a
medieval re-creation MUCK, looseness is allowed in areas that make the game
more fun, and the fun parts of medieval life are concentrated on instead of
the miseries.

Sherwood MUCK boasts a large public area and high standards on building,
characters and plots. In addition, Sherwood MUCK is fun for the whole family
since there are strict rules of public conduct, making sure players will not
stumble across sexual situations during the course of their play. No doubt,
this is a MUCK for people who specifically seek dramatic medieval role
playing, not so much for those who wish to socialize.
Finally, in answer to one of the most commonly asked questions, Sherwood
MUCK is not based on any single movie or story of Robin Hood. Instead, it is
fairly original, being an amalgam of influences but tending most toward the
actual folklore and earliest writings concerning Robin Hood. That means we
welcome your original characters, and you should by no means feel limited to
fulfilling stereotypes.

So if you like dramatic role play, medieval times, the legends of Robin
Hood, or merely wish to try playing a character in a well-organized and
high-quality environment, come give Sherwood MUCK a try! Characters are
created on the spot by staffers and wizards and no applications are
required for standard characters. Hope to see you there!

Mud         : Exile

WWW         : http://exile.lurker.net
Description :

   Exile is a MUD designed and built by serious MUD players

Mud         : Exodus
Code Base   : [Rom] Very Highly Modified
Telnet      : claret.ics.uci.edu 9000 [128.195.24.211]
WWW         : http://www.exodus-mud.org
Description :

Exodus is much more than a standard MUD. It’s the culmination of
over 8 years of progress and growth. Environments interact with
you as you journey through colorful lands, with the look and
feel of a well-written fantasy novel.

Choose from a variety of races. Some you know, like Dwarves,
Elves, and Humans. Others you may not, like Vro'ath and Litans.
Exodus has a quest-based remort system, so you can join more
unique races later in the game.

In the course of 90 levels, you have the option to switch
classes twice for multiclass combinations, but also rewarding
pure-class specialists with the most powerful skills and magic.
If you don't like your profession, you can reincarnate any time
and keep most of the experience you’ve earned.

Explorer? Immerse yourself in a huge world of custom areas with
over 17,000 rooms. Forget Midgaard and other stock areas. You
won't find them here. Two richly-detailed continents lie
within a great ocean spotted with islands large and small to
constantly challenge and reward the adventurous explorer.

We have a PK-based clan system and a variety of clans.
Wars let enemies to settle differences on the battlefield. A
bounty system puts rewards on the heads of those you cannot
kill. If you like friendly combat, we have two arenas for PvP
battles in a controlled environment. We also have regular PK
free-for-alls called Battle Royale, turning the game into a
bloodbath with a declared winner at the end. An in-depth kill
count system tracks your wins and losses in combat.

Mud         : Fading Suns Mush
Code Base   : [MUSH] PennMush 1.7.6p14
Telnet      : fadingsuns.org 4996 [69.57.136.37]
WWW         : http://fadingsuns.org
Description :

  It is the dawn of the sixth millennium and the Known Worlds
struggle to rise from the ashes of humanity’s greatest
civilization. For a thousand years peasants have huddled in
ignorance and fear among the ruins of past grandeur,
waiting for the suns themselves to fade to cinders while
haughty nobles, scheming guilders, and self-righteous
clergy squabble over the technological remnants of the lost
Second Republic. Now humankind has been reunited under the
banner of Alexius Hawkwood. Will the new Emperor halt the
descent into darkness and restore humankind's belief in
renewal and progress, or will the Light fade at last from
the universe?

The Fading Suns MUSH is set on the planet Vargo, a world
threatened by alien invasions and supernatural incursions.
Players take on the role of nobles, members of the League
of Merchants, and clergy of the Universal Church. Take a
stand against the coming darkness, and claim your destiny
on Vargo. Join us at the Fading Suns MUSH.

Mud         : Trials and Triumphs
Code Base   : [MUX]
Telnet      : spodzone.com 1350 [64.35.57.48]
WWW         : None
Description :

  The year: 2001. The New Heroic Age has just begun. Heroes and villains
abound in numbers far surpassing the benchmarks for the historical and
'mythological' heroes and villains of yesteryear. The threats, while still
categorized as good vs. evil, have been altered with the emergence of
magic, psionics, technology, alien species, mutants, clones, and even
agents of higher powers such as the Earthborn Angels, Mephisto, or the
Hellspawn.Earth is, unfortunately, woefully unprepared for the challenges
it is about to face from the convergence of all these intersections. The
United Nations is nervous, the leading countries of the world not far
behind. Mutant prejudice, while not as obvious as in the canon Marvel
universe, still exists, although usually relegated to the status of an
extremist group.But the universal constant of change forces humanity to
act, to find some way to unite and combat the growing threats. Within the
UN Security Council, talks have already begun in earnest to set up a
world-wide peacekeeping force composed of those super-powered beings with
heroic tendencies. Their mission: protect Earth from the supervillains and
from those who would try to subvert the planet for the cause of evil.This
is a world where the supernatural and superpowered hold sway... a world
where heroes protect those less fortunate from the petty whims of
villainy... this is the world of Trials and Triumphs.

Mud         : Ingvi's World
Code Base   : [MUCK] Fuzzball
Telnet      : crlh.tzo.org 4201 [208.180.124.11]
WWW         : None
Description :

  Ingvi's World started out as an elaborate present built for a
birthday LAN party, a puzzle for those attending to solve.  It
has been kept online afterward and has been extended to be a
fully operational MUCK.  The worldbuilding is based on its
creator's RPG world, and thus is a tour through his (sometimes
demented :)) imagination.  Building on Ingvi's World is encouraged:
there are no builder quotas and the MUCK creator intends always to
allow open building.  City areas ready for your imagination to
further augment are available, as are wild lands, and new areas
are easily available on request.  Preybots have been implemented
in the wild lands for those who like to hunt.  IW is a varied place,
with room for the creativity of many minds.  Come build and
(role)play with us!

Mud         : Fandra, Realm Of Destiny
Code Base   : [Rom] AMUSEd 4.0, derived partially from Rom2.4
Telnet      : portal.fandra.org 23 [195.90.131.231]
WWW         : http://www.fandra.org/
Description :

   We allow player killing, but require roleplay. Fandra offers you a
unique religions system and a beatiful world to explore. Some classes, like
cleric and priestknight, fully depend on chosen god. Following a God gives
additional skills, but makes you depend on your faithfulness, and on status
of your Temple. Temples can be raided by followers of an enemy god, and you
might loose recall and most of your prayers won't work until you re-raid.

   We have unique area set and solid world concept with creation story, map
and such. No Midgaard. You can choose a town to live in.

   We have quests, both automated and provided by immortals. ANSI Colors
are configurable. You can choose a different color for every channel, and
for many events, like someone using a certain skill.

   Mobs and even some items act wise, and there are many quests within our
areas. You won't get bored. Race/Hometown/Class/Religion combinations
provide enough different roles for you to play.

   If you are new to online RPGs, that's the right place to start -
Adventurer's Guild makes it's easy to learn to play. If you are an
expirienced player, and tired of countless stock area bases with no concept,
nothing new to explore and no role to play - Fandra will be a pleasant
surprise for you.

Mud         : Star Wars: Age of Alliances
Code Base   : [SWR] PennMUSH
Telnet      : Starwars.Xidus.Net 5500 [64.124.186.158]
WWW         : http://starwars.xidus.net/
Description :

  This MUSH was founded by fanatical Role Players who love Star
Wars and were sick and tired of just how awful all the other Star
Wars MUSH's are. SW:AoA was created to bring out the TRUE beauty
of the Star Wars galaxy and present a fantastic enviroment for
fans of RP!

  Come to SW:AoA if you want a great experience in this
fantastic galaxy. You will not be disappointed. The MUSH is no
longer 'new' its aged and experienced and its always looking for
fresh faces. We've passed the events of the original trilogy and
everything that happens in a Star Wars movie happened in our
timeline. The reset, the 'expanded universe', is up to what our
players make of
it!

  We're not following the direct path of the majority of crappy
novels that are on the market today, but we do pull from them
what is necessary to continue to breath life into the Star Wars
galaxy. Again, this MUSH was designed to be the most realistic
and honest-to-Theme, as well as the most dedicated to bringing to
life an EYE APPEALING appearance.

  Come to Star Wars: Age of Alliances, join the saga as its
meant to be in text form!

Mud         : Fate
Code Base   : [Emlenmud] FateCode (heavily modified Emlen)
Telnet      : fate.fatemud.com 7004 [131.155.141.99]
WWW         : http://www.fatemud.com/
Description :

Based upon a heavily modified Emlenmud, Fate is a PKmud in which the
forces of Good and Evil fight for supremacy. We offer a large variety of 
races, each with their own advantages. 

Besides the skills and spells available to everyone, our class-system 
allows you to specialize in a profession as you gain more experience. 
Upon choosing your profession, you gain access to specialized spells and
skills. There also are numerous guilds, each offering a unique bonus.

Numerous areas, filled with dangerous monsters and quests make this a
challenging place, even for the most experienced players. This makes 
choosing your allies very important: In fact your survival often depends 
upon it.

While death is not a permanent thing for normal charachters, we offer the
more daring players the ability to play a 'hardcore' character. While this
offers several large advantages over normal players, dying means exactly 
that: Your character is gone forever.

Join the struggle and choose your own Fate.

The Fate Admins

Mud         : Lands of Delusion
Code Base   : [Rom] (LoD version 1.6 Beta)
Telnet      :  
WWW         : http://www.landsofdelusion.com
Description :

 Lands of Delusion at this time (ON THIS PORT) isn't being worked
on. We have another port workin on it. We are bringing, you,
the players a grand unqiue feel. We are currently making more
like Final Fantasy, such as the Materia system working just like
in Final Fantasy VII, except class based. No more stock skill/
spell percent, it's just like the games.
 With this system, you either have the spell or you don't.
Class based meaning all classes can wear the Materia and level
it up, but you can't cast/use the spell/skill unless your say
Black mage for the Fire Materia (containing Fire1-4) or the
Blackbelt for the Kick Materia (containing Kick, Legsweep,
Roundhouse) and that such. These are gained on AP while
having the Materia SOCKETED into your weapon/armor. Each
Weapon/Armor has its own socketing abilities (1-5 slots)
depending on how good/bad the weapon is.
 We have the Triple Triad card game from Final Fantasy VIII,
it also is straight from the game. You can gain cards by
quests, immortal ran quests, or trading/challenging other players
to a game of Triple Triad. This gives players other things to do
other than levelup your character.
 Theres more! We also have a unique world map, non like most
others with areas just tossed here and there, we carefully
thought it out and placed according to storyline progression,
level based and questing purposes.
 Areas are unique and straight from the Final Fantasy games,
meaning RANDOM ENCOUNTERS, but the same monsters and that such
that you encounter on the games.
 Last but sure as **** not least we have clans. Yevon, The Empire,
The Returners, Avalanche, and ShinRa. I also thought about adding
a few extra which I won't state the names just yet. I'll leave that
for opening day. They each have DIVISIONS and RANKS within the clan
non like others just having ranks with DIVISION names within the
rank name...boring! The clans will not open starting out until
I see some ROLEPLAY envolving them and seeing that people will
really take care of the MUD and make it a better place with a
large system of ROLEPLAYING and continuous fun.
 We the staff of LoD have dedicated alot of our time into making
this the most realistic Final Fantasy themed MUD for your benefit
to come, get away from your REAL LIFE. Trade cards, challenge to
card duels, levelup, roleplay, EVEN BREED AND CATCH CHOCOBOS.
 This MUD has a lot to offer. Right now the older version of Lands
of Delusion is up and running, but hopefully soon we will have the
newer version of the game completely balanced out and ready for
players.
 Please, look forward to the new Lands of Delusion version because
I really think this will take all of the other Final Fantasy games
and just really toss them out for good.

    Thanks for reading this.
    Havoc
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!ATTENTION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
If you have any questions or/and would like to talk to me and
learn about when the MUD progesses more just contact me at the
following:
AIM: HavocLoD
ICQ: 174735277

Mud         : Feudal Realms
Code Base   : [Rom] Feudal v 0.9.6
Telnet      : feudalrealms.com 4242 [204.209.44.98]
WWW         : http://www.feudalrealms.com
Description :

  Welcome to Kirganthis and the city of Stonegate, a jewel
of a city in the central plains, a city that was once left
for dead after a decade long war against all of Goblinkind.
Rebuilt stronger and better than its predecessor, the city
stands as a monument to the alliance which turned the war
in favor of the humans, elves, dwarves, and other races who
held the walls and battlements.

  Inside the walls are found the Academie of Magic, where
centuries old research of the arcane is conducted, shops of
all sorts, both mundane and useful, the temple to the old,
and sometimes forgotten, Ancients who once roamed the world
unchecked and unchallenged, not to mention the people of
the town themselves.

  Breathe in the history, revel in the scenery and people,
live another life different from your own.  Every day more
and more of the continent is discovered, more people are
met, and a few more lives are taken, some accidentally and
some quite by purpose.  the city is for the most part safe,
but once one steps outside the massive gates, all is left
completely to chance.

Code Base   : [Unknown] ROM, GW, Lurf

WWW         : http://www.lurkingfear.net
Description :

   All the LURF you love, without all the crap you hate...

Lurking Fear III is BACK, based on the World of Darkness RPG
Highly modified code dervived from GodWars, ROM, and Lurf1/2

------------------------------------------------------------
- RolePlay enhanced PlayerKill, RP/PK Status based exp gains
- Unique blend of PK and actual RolePlay (enforced/rewarded)
- Clan and Sect hierarchy by class (Camarilla/Sabbat,Pack..)
- Standard GodWars features, plus extensive Lurf originals
- Realistic WoD classes - No Jedi, Highlanders, Amazons
- Ever growing playerbase
- All old Areas standardized and themed, Many original 
- Too many features worth checking out to list

Vampire  - 15 improved disciplines with up to 6 levels each
         - Generations, Clans, Prince, Primogen, blood hunts
Werewolf - 8 improved totems, with 4 advanced spirits
         - Tribes, Alphas, Betas
Mage     - Original mage code with 9 spheres with 6 levels each
         - Traditions, Archmages, Apprentices
Hunter   - More WoD only Classes planned...

Mud         : Buffy the Vampire Slayer MUX
Code Base   : [MUX] [MUX]
Telnet      : buffymux.betterbox.net 2001 [209.83.132.83]
WWW         : http://buffymux.betterbox.net
Description :

      'To each generation, there is a Chosen One. One girl in all the
world born with the strength and skill to hunt vampires, find them where
they gather and stop the spread of their evil and the swell of their
numbers. She is the Slayer.'

      Since its 1996 debut, Joss Whedon's 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' has
become one of television's most successful hits, as well as its resulting
spin-off, 'Angel'.  After a rough initiation into Slayerhood, Buffy moved to
Sunnydale, a quiet Californian town located about a two hours drive down the
freeway from her native L.A.. A 'one-Starbucks town', Sunnydale is quite the
downer. There is a significant lack of nightlife, decent shopping and
first-run movies. It also has the highest mortality rate in the nation, and
bizarre events are blamed on 'gangs on PCP' or 'gas leaks'.  As Buffy soon
finds, Sunnydale actually rests on a Hellmouth -- a center of mystical
convergence and hotspot of demonic activity. The city administration
actively moves to aid these cover-ups, unbeknownst to anyone in the
otherwise picturesque town. This leaves the human populace in a perpetual
state of oblivion, having no idea of the terrible danger and precarious
future that Sunnydale faces nightly, save the Slayer and her band of friends
as they fight to protect it.

    Meanwhile, Angel has since left his beloved Buffy's side, heading to
L.A. to fight for his redemption, facing the evils of a town that has been
without a Champion since Buffy's departure.  Evil law firms, vampire nests,
evil warlocks... it all can be found abundantly in L.A..  On a quest to help
the helpless in a city where nothing is as it seems and no one cares, the
only vampire with a soul enlists the help of his allies - and finds just how
evil the City of Angels really is.

    We have recently re-opened, introducing our L.A. grid.  This isn't the
Buffy the Vampire Slayer MUX you remember, it's even better!  Come visit us
today!

Mud         : The Final Challenge
Code Base   : [Dikumud] Heavily modified Diku/Merc
Telnet      : mud.finalchallenge.net 4000 [65.39.69.26]
WWW         : http://www.finalchallenge.net
Description :

  The Final Challenge began in March of 1994, and is more
commonly known to those who play it as TFC or 'the mud'. It
has a dedicated, addicted, & friendly player base from all 
over the world that enjoys meeting new people and
interacting.  TFC attracts a variety of types of players. 
You'll find players who place a heavy emphasis on role-
playing, those who are PKers, those who enjoy the puzzles,
challenges, and mobmasteries in the game, those who enjoy
exploring the almost entirely unique 12,000+ room world,
those who like to sit and chat, & those who are a mixture
of all of the above.  And you won't get lost in the crowd -
since there are generally 20-30 people online at a time.

TFC has a god-follower system and a variety of alignment
flavors that a character can choose from.  Of course, 
characters can also go it on their own and remain 
unaligned.  Characters may dual and triple class as well.  
Players may also have multiple characters (and many do), so
long as they are not online at the same time and are played
as separate individuals. Stop by mud.finalchallenge.net 4000 
and check it out for yourself.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Final Fantasy MUX
Code Base   : [MUX] MUX 2.3.3.22
Telnet      : heimdall.play-hookey.com 5403 [63.111.162.9]
WWW         : http://ffmux.play-hookey.com
Description :

The world of Final Fantasy MUX is that of a huge
convergence. The worlds of each Final Fantasy, from 1
through 11, as well as Tactics, have merged together into
one. The characters of those worlds, as well as those from
Tactics Advance, the Movie and various FF Anime sources have found
themselves in the converged world, and it's now up to them,
and the players behind them, to determine the fate of the
world.'

FFMUX is a heavily RP-oriented MUX, with no stat or combat
systems. PKing is forbidden. Characters can be gained
through application only, the details of which are on the
website. We're newbie friendly, with news, +help, staff and
players always around to lend a hand. Highest logins
usually occur during the evening hours (EST in the US).

Detailed information about the MUX as well as a listing of
available/taken characters can be found at our website.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Final Realms
Code Base   : [LP] LP mud with MudOS
Telnet      : login.finalrealms.org 4001 [80.232.38.254]
WWW         : http://frpages.finalrealms.org/
Description :

 Final Realms is a multiplayer, online, text-based, role-playing
game in a fantasy setting with a full complement of special 
features: persistent and controllable character development, 
static and interactive quests, cooperative and competitive 
combat, player controlled organizations, a variety of items and
creatures located in a vast world ready to be explored.

Each character selects a race and guild (profession) from a vast
assortment.  Each guild learns from a different variety of
abilities and spells. Players earn titles related to their
development, rank, and player-elected status.

Players may create, organize and expand their own groups that
are dedicated to specific purposes.  There are also many
existing Clans, Groups, Houses and Families that players join,
control, and advance in rank.

Numerous quests populate Final Realms with puzzles, mazes, keys
to find, and doors to unlock.  Artifacts and treasures are
guarded by dragons, demons and other mystical creatures. Many
quests require massive cooperation between skilled characters to
successfully complete. Magical items, spells and abilities are
earned by exploration, brains and brawn.  Special, interactive
quests also take place to shape the Realms' history.

The combat system on Final Realms is highly developed with melee
and missile weapons, a huge variety of magical spells and
healing effects. Each guild has unique abilities that grow as
a player gains experience. Player versus player combat is
allowed and well developed.

Mud         : Shadowrun Germany
Code Base   : [MUSH] none
Telnet      : germany.dnaco.net 6250 [207.238.206.198]
WWW         : http://cathouse.sindebauchery.net/germany
Description :

       Berlin: the sprawling, chaotic metroplex where the
only law is that there is no law. The City of Anarchy,
where only the toughest and smartest can hope to survive.
You think you're good, alter? Well, come to Berlin and
prove it, because if you can make it here, you can make it
anywhere. Shadowrunners are in high demand in this 'plex,
what with everyone from the megacorps to the org-crime
syndicates to the gangs, and everyone in between, all vying
for their piece of the pie. But mediocre 'runners don't
last long around here. You wanna stay alive, you gotta be
good, mann.

        Shadowrun Germany MUX is set amid this chaotic yet
lucrative hotbed of the Sixth World, based on the Germany
Sourcebook and incorporating Third Edition rules and 
Expansions. We allow a wide variety of character classes 
restricted or disallowed elsewhere, including metahuman
variants, ghouls, and even shapeshifters. Magical character
slots are available, and other shadowrunner archetypes--
fixers, deckers, riggers, street samurai, mercenaries,
demolitions experts, intrusion specialists, assassins,
melee combat masters, and just about anything else you
could think of--are allowed virtually without restriction.
So come to Berlin, chummer, and see what it's like running
in the darkest shadows to be found in 2061.

and Secret of Mana, with odds and ends from other games.  
Using a Job System mostly based from FFT and FF5, a player 
can change his abilities at most any point.  While most of 
the players aren't exactly newbie-friendly, we will answer 
questions on the newbie channel that is automatically 
turned on for new characters.  We also offer a newbie 
school to teach the intricacies of our MUD, such as 
quitting in an inn to keep equipment.  Please, *please* use 
our newbie school to its full effect, as this MUD isn't 
quite like your average MUD.  Our gossip channel is a 
bit... adult... so be careful.

  Welcome to Crimson Nightmares. This is an updated listing to the
original. The code base is GW2K modified in an extreme manner. A
lot of pride is taken, And every attempt is made to accommodate
player ideas and suggestions. Players have been responsible for the
idea's that created 2 new custom classes. We currently offer the
following classes: Angel, Cyborg, Demon, Dragon, Drow, Elemental, Mage,
Ninja, Phoenix, Vampire, and Werewolf. With the exception of Cyborg's,
every class can be combined together giving us over 80 possible combo's
of multiclassing (cyborgs are being added currently). We have a functional
weather system, with random lightning that is real, meteor storms, and more
being added weekly. Players can now create several custom messages to enhance
thier gameplay to what suits them instead of pre-determined messages. 

We have re-worked our staff, and have changed our approach to player relations
in the hopes of generating an even larger player base in the future. This MUD
requires time and effort, and nothing is just handed to you here. If you want
a MUD with a challenge, come check us out.

Sincerely,  
The Staff of Crimson Nightmares

Mud         : Duel Grounds
Code Base   : [Rom] Tartarus, Heavily Modded
Telnet      : dgmud.net 9999 [207.44.134.24]
WWW         : None
Description :

 Duel Grounds is a MUD inspired by games like the Carrion Fields. Here, a player can
experience the fun and the rush of constant PK, competing against each other for the title
of the best. Role play is not enforced, but players are expected to follow their cabal
(clan) rules. The game is focused around player-killing, or more specifically, cabal wars,
and control of cabal items. We offer 11 playable classes and 17 playable races, with 3
addition quest races. We have a large, mostly original map for players to explore and
enjoy; as well as many new area features to make mobs/objects more challenging and
interesting, including room/obj/mob programs. If you're looking for a challenging place to
vent your rage, or just a MUD where you don't have to spend hundreds of hours before
things get exciting, check us out.

Mud         : Forgotten Weyrs
Code Base   : MUSH
Telnet      : weyrs.silvertree.org 4301 [63.199.182.123]
WWW         : http://www.spundreams.net/fw/
Description :

   Forgotten Weyrs is a game set in the 3rd interval, with no threadfall in 
living memory nor any thread due for at least another hundred years.  It 
has Anne McCaffrey's permission to run as per 'news anne' on the game, and 
is set in a non-canon minor hold (Forsaken) and two non-canon Weyrs (No and 
Who Knows) set in the Western Island chain.  There are currently posted 
crafters but no PC crafthalls, though this could change if enough interest 
develops.  There is an online registration system in place which insures 
that people are familiar with Pern and with the specific timeline.  We would 
rather new players be familiar with the books, especially _Dragonsdawn_ and 
_Moreta_, but do not ask whether they have read the books unless they very 
clearly demonstrate a lack of understanding in their character application.  
Player dragons are allowed with rider and wizard approval.  At this time we 
are not allowing characters to be riders unless they have impressed in a 
hatching on Forgotten Weyrs, though we reserve the right to make exceptions.

Mud         : Winter's Edge
Code Base   : [MUSH] Tinymush 3
Telnet      : winter.mushpark.com 3000 [207.8.143.27]
WWW         : http://www.winters-edge.com
Description :

  In the First Age of the World, magic and form were one and the
  same. It was a mystical and wondrous time, a time before the
humanoids
  walked the earth. The great dragons were the powers of the
land, roaming and shaping life itself as they saw fit, as if they
were gods. The gods were angered by the presumption of the
dragons... The dragon uprising was crushed before it even began,
the primordial wyrms trapped in a new realm, splitting the magic
from the mundane.

  The Second Age was filled with wonder and glory, though little
  magic. Soon, the races were flourishing under the world that
the dragons once guarded. The dragons plotted, and grew mad with
the influence of the Mists. Their half-wyrmish descendants
unlocked the Mists, and even though the opening was brief, havoc
spread. After time, and with great loss, the mad wyrms were
banished once more, and the Third Age began, with weakened Mists.
Magic flourishes once more on the world, and the time of heroes
has come.

  Winter's Edge is a completely original world. All theme,
  cities, deities, and areas are completely from scratch and
created by the staff here. We are using races, classes, and stats
from 3rd Edition Dungeons and Dragons. Currently the only races
and classes allowed as Player Character(PC) races/classes are the
'standard' races and classes
contained in the 3rd edition Player's Handbook, and a
selection of custom variants on existing races. We are currently
open for beta-testing.

Mud         : The Four Lands
Code Base   : [Dikumud] Over 90% modified.
Telnet      : elwar.com 7777 [24.214.39.185]
WWW         : http://www.elwar.com/fourlands/
Description :

The Four Lands, a world, based loosely on Terry Brooks' Shannara
series, that is dedicated to the most intensive Role-Playing
experience with the feeling of total immersion into a seperate
reality. When you log into The Four Lands you are stepping into
a whole other world. With seven years of development and two
years of being open to the public, this game is the ultimate for
those hard core gamers that are looking for the diamond in the
rough, the sanctuary from frivality, the adrenaline pumping
excitement that can only come from transporting yourself into
another space and time to take on all of the emotions and
experiences of your alter-ego.
 
A realistic yet challenging skill system that reflects the
realistic way in which people learn, allowing players to choose
a class merely as their inborn talents with the ability to gain
the skills of all the other classes. A world that reflects
reality with flowing rivers and gravity, a weather system that is
different from the warm sunny south to the cold, snowy northland
mountains. With carriages, horses, saddles and reins, the 25000+
original room world is ready for exploration. With a dynamic
economy that involves the miner who mines the metals for the
smelter to create better metals who sells it to the blacksmith to
forge into a fine weapon or piece of armor to be sold for a cost
based on cost of material, craftsmanship, and uniqueness.
Everything from shoes to loaves of bread can be made by the
player run economy.

Mud         : Nebmedes
Code Base   : [MOO]
Telnet      : nebmedes.o-r-g.org 7777 [207.113.83.225]
WWW         : http://nebmedes.o-r-g.org:8000/
Description :

 Nebmedes is a roleplaying game set in the fantastic city of the same name.  It
is the capital of the High Kingdom of Ta-shamerew, the Empire.  We've drawn
from ancient Egyptian culture and mythology to form the core of the world, the
pantheon, the architecture, the food and dress, but we have also added in
touches from our own imagination.  The game is not historically accurate; it's
not Egypt, though it is similar.

We focus strongly on roleplaying over rollplaying.  This isn't to say that we
ignore the system and run things free form, we wouldn't be playing with a
system at all if that is what we were aiming at.  What that does say is that
we have set up XP so that a pure roleplay character will advance as quickly as
an 'adventurer'.  We have a strong focus on plot before killing things;
politics, investigation and discovery all take precedence over 'Dead Monster!'
and yet, with the dice one bad roll won't destroy a player unless they've
placed themselves in a stupid position.  Dice are secondary to roleplaying,
but in some conflict resolution, the dice are there for a reason. We've worked 
hard to allow the players a useful position in the world besides
as 'adventuring heroes'.  For example, we have modified the rules on crafting
and masterwork items to allow crafters to do their job in a reasonable amount
of time and we do not now, nor are we ever planning on having 'vendors' on the
grid.  There is also the noble court, a unique chance for players to get
involved with the politics of the city and actually influence what happens
there.  This is a chance for PCs to involve themselves in the game to make
decisions and see the impact on the world.

Players can make a sage, a craftsman, an adventurer, a politician, a soldier,
a hunter or anything else that strikes their fancy, and all have a place and a
use within the world.  It's D&D, yes, but it's not a MUD.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Tarmon Gai'don
Code Base   : [Rom] Gary MicNickle's WoT 1.2 (Based on Merc/Diku/Rom)
Telnet      : tarmongaidon.org 5000 [209.61.182.164]
WWW         : None
Description :

Tarmon Gai'don is the home of a new Wheel of Time Mud code base,
'WoT' based on ROM2.4b6 and offers the following:

. All-new, 100% original areas designed exclusively to fit the Wheel of Time
  world.  Possibly the most book-accurate on the net.  Desc's 5-15 lines long.
. All 'Wheel of Time' races are supported. You won't find any elves or dwarves 
  here.  Humans and Ogier are open, with Fades, Trollocs and Draghkar slated 
  for the future.
  Character Generation support: 3 classes, 20+ sub-classes & talents and over
  100  homelands/clans/steddings to optimize individual and unique characters.
. Completely original guild system, featuring potential for over 2 dozen
  playable guilds.  Guilding is not mandated to role-play.
. Role-play environments ranging from 100% IC areas, quests, faires, and other
  events.
. A completely IC channeling system, designed to follow the Wheel of Time 
  One Power as close as possible.  Weaves and flows are dependent upon your
  strength in the power. Overchanneling can lead to burning out.
. Realistic submission/ player death code (PK death) to disuade useless PK. 
. an intriguing `introduction` system, so if you have never met someone, you
  truly don`t know them. Players appear as `An Andoran`, etc. until Greeted. 
. A completely original and amusing optional WoT newbie area,
  along with newbie friendly players and immortals.

Mud         : Jusenkyo Mordor
Code Base   : [Mordor] RP-enhanced, highly modified Mordor v5.05
Telnet      : sotalecia.dyndns.org 4040 [68.84.38.74]
WWW         : None
Description :

 Jusenkyo Mordor is neither set in Jusenkyo, nor Mordor.
Despite the inaccuracy of the name, it is still a
highly-unique gameworld, with the focus entirely on
RP.
 
The setting is on the floating isles of Eraniss,
located near the Nexus, a point which is near many
universes, some of which the various player characters
hail from.
 
Eraniss is a tumultous place, with imported technology
beginning to spread, native magic prevalent, and
imported magic not uncommon. It is into this place the
 
new arrival enters, having been forcibly removed from
their home by the Nexus, and made subject to undesired
physical changes by the chaotic magic of the Nexus.
 
The setting is that of a world overrun by others from
outside: people, demons, and strange creatures. Some
with the desire to do good, others with the will for
power. And sometimes, the Nexus, the chaotic thing
which dominates the nature of the world and does not
let those outsiders die, will change slightly,
adapting new things into it.
 
And it is into this world the new character arrives.

Mud         : The Gathering
Code Base   : [Unknown] Gatherer
Telnet      : gathering.org.uk 5000 [194.153.168.161]
WWW         : http://www.gathering.org.uk/
Description :

   The Gathering is one of the oldest talkers still running.
It is based around groups rather than rooms and to improve
the experience, users can be in several groups at the same
time.  This enables you to chat in one of the public groups,
chat privately with friends or loved ones and discuss your
favourite band with a group of fans.

Unlike most talkers, there are no staff to manage
interpersonal disputes.  Instead, users are given the power
to protect themselves from verbal attack - even going as far as
being able to ban other users.

Combined with both these features are all the standard facilities     
you expect from a modern talker - mail, news, games, ANSI color - 
making it a fun and enjoyable play to chat for everyone.

Description :

 GD2K is based upon the comic book series 'Gold Digger' 
by Fred Perry. Gold Digger is a mix of fantasy, action-
adventure, comedy, and many other things. The main
characters include an Indiana Jones type adventurer, her 
adopted were-cheetah sister, the clone they accidentally 
created who is a mix of the both of them; an alien from 
another world; and an eight-year-old boy who is a genius at 
genetics and has created his own three-person army 
consisting of a ninja, a magic-user, and a genetically 
enhanced brawler. The adventurer, one Gina Diggers, is the 
daughter of an arch-mage father from Earth and a master 
armswoman/adventurer from the magical realm of Jade. Her 
sister Britanny is the last surviving were-cheetah, rescued 
by Gina's father from the brutal were-cheetah/were-wolf war 
21 years ago, and brought back to Atlanta with his family.

Gold Digger also includes leprechauns, troll archmages, 
harpies, evil sentient time-travelling dogs, Altantis, 
Shangra-La, were-creatures of many different kinds, and 
much more. 

Information on how to get a character is available on the 
GD2K website.

   Genesis is the original LPMud, though little remains of
the stuff from the early days. The emphasis of the mud is
to be a challenging game. Themes includes Tolkien, Dragon
Lance and many others. The world is strictly medieval
fantasy based.

   There are many features that sets it apart from most
other muds. One of the most enjoyable aspects is the
interesting and ever-changing interaction between different
guilds. Relations range from alliance to uneasy truce with
the occasional outbreak of war.

Another special feature are events, that are planned and
executed by a special team of wizards from time to time.

   Being a newbie is a struggle on Genesis. You are a puny
weakling in a world that is quite hostile. It is up to
you to explore very carefully, or find someone stronger
to show you the ropes.

   Wizardhood is by application. We are always happy if
skilled coders and storytellers want to join us.

Mud         : Genocide
Code Base   : [LP] customized driver based on LP 3.2.1, custom mudlib
Telnet      : geno.org 2222 [216.127.70.229]
WWW         : http://www.geno.org/
Description :

Genocide is not a typical mud; rather, it is a competitive
24-hour wargame.  Players compete in wars that go on 
constantly.  Levels are gained by killing other players in a 
variety of different war types, including team and non-team.  
Currently, most serious play takes place in leagues where 
teams are drafted and matches are played each week; smaller 
pickup games occur throughout the remainder of each week.

the dark fey.  Here, the weak are mere playthings, and those who

Mud         : MUDII
Code Base   : [Custom]
Telnet      : mudII.co.uk 23 [212.187.255.136]
WWW         : http://www.mudII.co.uk/
Description :

MUDII is one of only two sites in the world hosting the latest version of 
MUD, the very first multi-player adventure game. MUD1 or EssexMUD (as the 
original MUD is now known as) was developed by Richard Bartle & Roy Trubshaw 
in 1978 at Essex University, England. Since 1978 MUD has been in constant
development resulting in a highly original and slick game that can be played
here today.

MUDII is a MUD that is set in a timeless alternative reality. This is a 
world where you can be who you want when you want. The community at MUDII is
large and very friendly, they are always willing to welcome and help out
newbies. Quests, Houses (guilds), competitions, events, mud-related online
magazines and numerous associated websites are all part and parcel of this
incarnation of MUD.

MUDII is run by Muddled Games Ltd. which was formed in 2001 to run the game
for the community that previously played on Wireplay. MUD2 had been running 
on Wireplay since August 1997 until the game was closed down there.

As well as the pay per play system a low monthly subscription fee is
available. New players get a free 6 hours to get going and there is a free 
happy hour available nightly.

Mud         : Beauty

Telnet      : games.dragonpro.com 6969 [24.171.84.227]
WWW         : None
Description :

 Beauty was originally loosely based on the BDSM books by Anne
Rice titled 'Sleeping Beauty'. However, it has drastically changed
& very little has to do with the books at all. It is a fantasy
place for RP with variences in sci-fi technology and a feudal type
of society encouraging BDSM type of play/RP. Beauty chargen does
not restrict race or abilities-most of everything is up to the
player's RP ability. We try to accommodate all players here. We do
not enforce BDSM play, or any other kind of play, in OOC area. On
the grid, you are likely to see public BDSM displays.
 
The premise is simple: A magical island has an evil ruler,
Masters/Mistresses and slaves. I'll leave the rest up to your
imagination. If you want to come and be a furry, warrior, wizard,
dragon, cyborg, etc...you are welcome. The island is timeless so
there are a variety of  races/types/creeds in play and everyone is
also welcome to just come and hang out at the OOC Lounge. So
come to Beauty and make it your home. It's a beautiful and fun
place to be.

Mud         : Arcadia
Code Base   : [Rom] highly modifed; many customizations
Telnet      : mud.arcadia.net 4000 [64.90.160.100]
WWW         : http://arcadia.net/MUD/
Description :

Arcadia is a Diku-based ROM derivative PKill MUD, with characters being  
protected from PK until level 8.

The creation system is very newbie-friendly (though ANSI color is
suggested) and we have an enhanced array of beginning races available.
There are two levels of remortality (and more) for those who reach the
maximum mortal levels, with extra races and classes available to them.

Politics and role-play figure into the game with clans, sects, cartels,
and guilds -- and we've introduced private housing player characters
may purchase within their home cities, or rent within the more urban
centers (character homes are, generally, inviolate and save any items
in them through quit-outs and reboots).

Arcadia has many new and original areas, and we're expanding all the
time with new areas, new code, and new classes.

The citizens of Arcadia invite you to come enjoy the Lands and to meet
and make some new friends.

Mud         : ShadowMUD
Code Base   : [LP] ShadowMUD v1.0 - derived from Nightmare v3.2
Telnet      : theblacktower.com 3000 [24.168.182.89]
WWW         : http://None
Description :

   Curiosity is a powerful drive that can bring great wealth and power.
But be careful that you don't awaken the Evil One in your searching;
He sleeps but lightly and his temper is vile. Only 500 years have 
passed since the last confrontation, we pray you let there be another 
500 years of peace before the terror returns....

   ShadowMUD's varied lands spread across the vast continent of Caspia
and into the Walgor Sea: icy wastes, wide open plains, swamps,
deserts, and jungles hold many different cities and races. The face 
of the world evolves over time with the inevitable changing of history, 
and partly in ways molded by the adventurers of the realm. Over almost 
a decade, these changes have been to the cities, the geography and 
the townsfolk, and also to the adventurers of the realm and their 
careers. There is a lot of variation among the classes available to 
adventurers, and within each class there are many different abilities 
a character may learn. 

   In addition to the classes that guide one's adventuring career,
there are guilds, each run almost completely by players and sponsored
by one Immortal, that offer significant roleplaying opportunities, 
and can provide a tightly-knit group of friends. The realm has several
full-blown quests, all but one of which are optional, and numerous
mini-quests that are all optional. There are many places to explore,
unique monsters to find, and deeds you may commit that can change how
the townsfolk of various places respond to your character. Gather
enough adventuring experience, exploration, deed-doing and questing,
unique kills and other general adventuring prowess, and you may become
a Legend of ShadowMUD.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : HogwartsMOO
Code Base   : [MOO] MOO 1.8.1 + WAIF & FUP
Telnet      : hogwartsmoo.net 7500 [204.91.10.102]
WWW         : http://hogwartsmoo.net/
Description :

 HogwartsMOO is one of the first Harry Potter-inspired roleplaying
games, set originally in the early 1900's but now entering the 1920's
on a 4:1 timescale (a term corresponds to seventeen weeks).

Our theme is non-canon, capturing the charm of Wizarding society
without Rowling's storyline. None of the novels' feature characters (or
relatives) will ever appear in our world. Instead, key roles are held by
player-created characters. Our focus is Hogwarts School of Witchcraft
and Wizardry, but we have an extremely flexible creation system,
allowing players to have multiple characters in roles ranging from infant
to student (in any year) to professional adult in any of several dozen
currently defined magical careers (and we'll always accept suggestions).

Our goal is fun, realistic roleplay: we offer extensive help systems and
infrastructure (such as personal logging, reposes-on-demand, House
points in hourglasses, etc.) and detailed areas such as London, Diagon
Alley, Hogwarts itself, Hogsmeade, and the Forest. However, we have no
coded spells or levels: we trust our players to roleplay responsibly.

Please visit our webpage, check the Online Characters listing, read a few
logs, and explore our world. Newbies and veterans alike are welcome!

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Granite: New Hampshire by Night
Code Base   : [MUSH] TinyMUSH 2.2.4U1
Telnet      : granite.erisian.net 2005 [216.127.139.7]
WWW         : http://www.erisian.net/~granite/
Description :

   On December 24, 2004, out of the sight of mortals, a
castastrophe of epic proportions disrupted the supernatural
world in a violent and decisive way.  Manchester, New
Hampshire awoke the next day changed, and with it much of 
way of things to come.  Though the initial rumblings have
faded, their causes are still a source of mystery to anyone
who knew what happened. Down underneath the surface lurk a
lot of dark answers, a promise to be fulfilled, and a lot
more questions....  

Telling the good guys from the bad guys is not easy, even as
the state motto 'Live Free or Die' is scrawled in graffiti 
on overpasses and disused billboards.  

We are a writer's chronicle, encouraging collaborative
fiction among our players which we support through our short
story list.  Granite is a haven for those weary of storyless,
unfulfilling games with wholesale PK and other social ills.
Come join our game community and experience some of the best.

Mud         : The Great Hunt
Code Base   : [Rom] Rom 2.3 as Basecode
Telnet      : bb12.betterbox.net 8500 [209.83.132.85]
WWW         : http://www.fortunecity.com/rivendell/final/153/
Description :

   The Great Hunt is based on the Wheel of Time series of books by
Robert Jordan.  The human race is chosen by what region of the
WOT universe you originate from.  There are also an option
to choose to be either Ogier (from 3 Steddings) or Shadowspawn
(2 trolloc races and 1 myrdraal).  You enter the game in the city
of Baerlon, and should enjoy discovering all the other unique
WOT based areas including the Ways, the cities of Tear, Camlyn,
Shadar Logoth, Tar Valon, Fal Dara and many others.  The Great Hunt
is a player killing MUD with a five level limit.  TGH is a 
newbiefriendly MUD with several Tuatha'an helpers dedicated
only to help the newbies out.  There are several Guilds to 
pick from, including for example Aes Sedai, Warders, Seanchan,
DragonSworn, Whitecloak and several others.

Code Base   : [MUX]
Telnet      : pimux.betterbox.net 1997 [209.83.132.70]
WWW         : http://pimux.betterbox.net/
Description :

We've changed sites, but we're still here!

What if the heroes lost?

That's not just an 'if,' that's the situation in Beacon Harbor.  The
villains are firmly in control, and an experiment gone horribly wrong has
torn open the fabric of space and time, bringing in super-powered entities
from other universes and trapping them there!

Play a character right from the comics, play an original character, or even
mix-and-match to play a comic character the way you thought they should
have been written.  Application is by e-mail, the roleplay is free-form,
and combat is not coded.

Check out our website, sign onto the MUX as a Guest and ask around.  Hero,
villain, Crimelord, or innocent bystander?  Will you save the city, or
doom it further?

Mud         : Star Wars: Ways of the Force MUSH

Telnet      : swwfm.net 4201 [216.235.252.221]
WWW         : http://www.swwfm.net/
Description :

The date is approximately 5,000 years prior to Episode 1, it is a time of struggle, 
exploration, and hope as the newly formed Republic grows with the aid from the Jedi 
Order. However, as in most cases, corruption begins out of good intent and the balance 
of the galaxy's opposing good and evil forces is once again put into play. Along with 
the struggle and hope, comes chaos and strife with the emergence of the Sith. It 
is a time of building, a time of subtleties, and a time of silence just before the 
storm. A thin line is walked between calm and chaos, but stretches tighter with 
each passing day.
 
The MUSH is open and IC. All players are welcomed, please log in as Guest and use 
the +register command.
 
Come and experience the Force for yourself!

Mud         : The Eternal Fantasy
Code Base   : [LP] Highly modified LPC-based
Telnet      : bb14.betterbox.net 3333 [207.206.185.91]
WWW         : http://cs1.betterbox.net:3330/
Description :

 The Eternal Fantasy is a mud based on the popular game
series 'Final Fantasy' by Squaresoft.  

The mud offers players a growing list of races, including
Human, Elf, Moogle, Half-Elf, Half-Lunar, Kelban and Dwarf.
Also, players can alternate between over 60 classes -- 
including knights, paladins, ninjas, assassins, archmagi,
thief, and treasure hunters -- through a system borrowed
from Final Fantasy Tactics.  This allows players to select 
both a primary class and a secondary class, combining the 
abilities of both.

Four of Squaresoft's most popular games (Final Fantasy 1, 
Final Fantasy 4, Final Fantasy 5 and Final Fantasy 6) are 
combined in an already large and constantly growing network 
of worlds with an overall plot that links all of them.

Although it is currently still under Gamma testing, players 
and ancients (wizards) are newbie friendly, quests are 
plentiful, and there is much discovering to be made.  
Players are welcome to submit ideas, as well as contribute 
in world wide quests run by the administration. For the avid
Final Fantasy fan, or just one looking for a mud to play, 
this game is definately something to consider playing.

Mud         : Grimne DikuMUD
Code Base   : DikuMUD
Telnet      : grimne.org 4000 [129.241.210.220]
WWW         : http://www.grimne.org/
Description :

   Grimne is the ultimate incarnation of a violent, hack-n-slash mud.
Filled with stat hungry, equipment hoarding players, blood and carnage
are all that matter.  With a shaman that sells stats to higher level
characters, and a storage room in which items can be stored
indefinately for a small fee, there is an ongoing competetion as to
who is the 'best' in each class.  Damage by each player can be
logged, and the more successful one is at inflicting punishment upon
mobs, the more one is respected.  Experience, gold and equipment are
the ruling forces, and power is the ultimate reward.  Newbies, however,
are not forgotten.  An extensive newbie-guide is among the
equipment received upon character creation, including such basics
as how to talk and where to go.  In addition, certain mobs will cast
beneficial spells upon low level characters, and there is a
newbie channel and a constantly updated list of 'newbie helpers'
to whom one can ask questions.  If you wish to do away with all
of the fluff of some of the overdone muds and get right down
to the honesty of pure violence and greed, come to Grimne.  You
won't be disappointed.

Mud         : Harshlands
Code Base   : [Dikumud] Heavily Modified
Telnet      : harshmud.role-play.net 5555 [206.176.129.35]
WWW         : http://www.harshlands.net/
Description :

   Harshlands is a roleplay intensive, skills-based MUD set on the island
of Harn (Columbia Games).  Standard 'hack and slash' play is seriously
dissuaded, with levels, classes and experience points non-existent.
Players can choose to pursue careers, including herbalist, journeyman
craftsmen, soldier, guide, criminal and law enforcer.  Players proving
to be skilled and dedicated are offered choices that include shop
ownership, master level craftsmanship, nobility and many advanced
professions.  For those unfamiliar with Harn, it is a low-magic world
based loosely on a composite of 9th-14th century Britain.  The game
world includes over 16,000 original rooms in smoothly integrated and
universally consistant zones, ten deities, five human ethnic and
cultural groups, and three non-human races selectable by players of
proven ability.  While the thrust and focus of the game is serious
roleplay, the world remains a deadly and harsh environment, where life
is risky and death is permanent.

Mud         : Peninsulae SPQR
Code Base   : [Unknown] Severly changed Perlmud 3.0
Telnet      : spqr.game-host.org 7777
WWW         : http://spqr.game-host.org
Description :

"While trying to sail over the mediterranean sea you got lost, and
finally your ship grounded on an offshore barrier reef. The result
is simple, here you are on an island, the inhabitants live the
ancient roman way, still hoping to be rescued.
If that happened to you hours ago, weeks or years, you are here now,
and have to live in this world with mixed ancient cultures, weird
rites and slavery...."

SPQR is a free, online, text-based game with a unique BSDM theme. It
is for adults only, but it is not a game about sex. The player
seeking a hastened sexual encounter within SPQR has missed its
purpose, for SPQR is a roleplaying game about the slavery lifestyle.
Slavery is its theme, but personal slavery is optional.

Each new character begins life marooned but free. Throughout life,
a character may either be trained as a slave or cultivate enough
standing to become the owner of slaves. A character may even learn
the particular trade of the cleric, dungeonmaster, guard, innkeeper,
merchant, trainer, or perhaps some new, yet unknown path. All this
depends upon the aspirations of the player.

Because a strong fantasy roleplaying environment is desired,
roleplaying is mandatory within SPQR. Multiplaying and character-
sharing are forbidden, though a single, alternate character can be
obtained on a conditional basis.

Weather patterns change seasonally. Room descriptions vary at night.
Personal descriptions may include multiple levels of clothing to
reflect the detail along various stages of dress, customized
according to the whim of the player. An extremely advanced,
directable emoting system is available to assist the enterprising
roleplayer at times when the stock emoting commands are found
wanting. Money acquired during the game can be spent on custom items,
room rental, slave rental, and various other sorts of player-driven
transactions.

Online help, website help, a player newsboard, an optional newbie
channel, and a friendly playerbase are all at hand to help 
familiarize new players.

Mud         : 4 Dimensions
Code Base   : [Circlemud] bpl15 modified
Telnet      : 4d.mud-puddle.net 6000 [68.22.64.10]
WWW         : http://www.4dimensions.org
Description :

4 Dimensions is set at a time after a massive nuclear war has caused 
great rifts in the Time Warp of Universe. Due to those rifts, 
generally known as 'Time Traps', you can travel freely between 
different time periods. Some enterprising people have set up a 
Travel Agency, making it easier for adventurous Travellers to explore 
the different Dimensions of Time.

There are 4 main 'Worlds' that you can visit; Pre Historic, Medieval, 
Old West and Future, each with 100% unique zones - you won't find any 
stock areas in 4D. This makes our mud especially interesting for 
those that like the extra challenge of exploring and solving Quests. 
Even our Mud School is customized, with 4 grades (one for each 
Dimension) and a unique 'Quest Academy' at the top, teaching some of 
the tricks of mudding, that usually only very experienced players 
know about.

At present there are over 180 zones, more than 70000 rooms and over 
hundred built-in Quests of varying difficulty. Many of our long time 
players build for us, so the world is growing at a steady rate. With 
the Quest prizes you can buy some of our special 'features' like 
crash-proof houses, and personalized equipment, pets, mounts and 
vehicles. 

4D is and will always be totally free to play, although we have more 
features than many Pay-to-Play Muds. Our remort and skill system is 
very advanced, allowing you to continuously improve your character. 
The full potential of the Game only unfolds as you play it, but 
already in Mud School you'll get a taste of what to expect later on.

So come and enjoy one of the most developed and original free Muds on 
the net! Some of the content in the zones is a bit 'mature', so this 
is not a mud for the very young or very prudish.

Mud         : Storms of Time
Code Base   : [Merc] MrMud 1.4 - Emud 3.0
Telnet      : slackhalla.org 4321 [217.19.28.128]
WWW         : http://www.stormsoftime.com
Description :

We offer our players the ability to build their own castle which can
be turned into a clanhall. Clans are entirely player run. The mud
has been designed to not need any immortals, and even has a suicide
command for the rare occasion you get stuck in a no exit room with
no way to get out, as well as morgues to buy your corpse in case you
cannot get back to your corpse.

Every area has one or more quests players can complete for
equipment. Our mob prog support is one of the best, all areas
combined holding over 80.000 lines of script code. Finding and 
completing the unique quests will be a lot of fun for those who
like a challenge.

There are many classes to choose from, each with their own strong
set of skills, as well as many races. Each character can
reincarnate, if they desire, up to 10x, with a choice of stronger
races available in each incarnation. The 'auto' command can be used
to cast spells automatically at double speed, making spell casters
as easy to play as fighters.

We feature a VT102 interface to replace the traditional prompt,
allowing good gameplay with a basic telnet client such as putty.

The areas are connected with a huge system of roads which can be
automatically walked down using the travel command, combined with
the help file showing a world map, as well as road signs, most
areas will be easy to find.

See you there :)

Description :

FLY THROUGH THE TIMES OF IMAGINATION.  Visit ancient Graecia and 
Rome, by all means!  However, there are also ancient celtic gods and
their druids to deal with.  Fight King Arthur or his nemesis Mordred
or both!  (Whichever suits the need of your character.)  Travel to 
the present where you can kill their ghosts or she who guards 
Excalibur.  Present times also bring the possible onslaught of 
goblins and Bugs Bunny (newbie areas).  Are you a Magic fan?
