Mud         : Happy Mud
Code Base   : [Envy] Updated to UltraEnvy, then to Greed, then some Smaug
Telnet      : x.hjsoft.com 2400 [24.104.48.213]
WWW         : http://x.hjsoft.com/~mud/
Description :

  Happy Mud started roughly 9 years ago in UTexas, Austin, eventually moving to LVC,
and then to paid hosting services such as mudsrus.  We have now finally migrated to an
ex-player's server and are currently running very nicely there.  Nearly every pfile is
still present.  Please send an email if you wish to have your character back.

  We have finally completed our personal Happy Area Creator, a windows GUI/program which
is very helpful in designing areas for Happy MUD.  The program comes complete with
installer and a sample area (from stock greed code) and is available at our website.

  Current features include: three remort choices, which determine which of 28
superclasses you can choose, 20 different theme based worlds, debatably the most advanced
autoquesting code, 'undo spell' spells, ressurection spells, pc repair of weapons and
armor,  50 levels for remorting, 950 continuous non-remort levels for superclasses,
nifty naming (easier to reference objects), nearly every sentient NPC can have a
conversation, surging for superclasses (spend more mana to enhance every spell effect
(duration, damage, etc.), along with mastery skills that enhance the efficiency of this), 
etc.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Multi-User Dungeon (British Legends)
Code Base   : [Custom] Ported from the BCPL original
Telnet      : british-legends.com 27750 [24.112.131.135]
WWW         : http://www.british-legends.com/
Description :

Multi-User Dungeon, or MUD for short, was the first ever game of this genre.
For many years, MUD, or British Legends as it was known to players, existed
on the CompuServe Information Service. In the fall of 1999, however, CIS
decided to terminate British Legends as part of their Y2K cleanup efforts.
Many players thought that this meant the end of their beloved game.

That is not so. The present incarnation is a high-fidelity port of the
original MUD code base to a modern server platform. This accurate
reimplementation faithfully reproduces almost all the original's features,
even some of the bugs that have become part of the game's lore.

If you want to see what multiplayer gaming was like in the Land where it all
began, and visit a game that still offers superior game play and balance,
a visit to MUD at http://www.british-legends.com/ will be worth your time!

This version of MUD/BL was written with the permission of the original
copyright holder by Viktor T. Toth (aka Viktor the arch-wizard, formerly
MrSpock the wizard) in a 'mad programming binge' (as MUD's original author,
Richard Bartle called it) in December 1999, and has been in limited
operation on a test site since. It was opened to the public in May, 2000.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : GargoyleMOO
Code Base   : [MOO] LambadaMOO (Foo Modified)
Telnet      : gargoyle.immortaltwilight.com 11020 [68.54.1.133]
WWW         : http://www.immortaltwilight.com/gargoyle/index.html
Description :

One thousand years ago, superstition and the sword ruled.
It was a time of darkness.
It was a world of fear.
It was the age of Gargoyles.
Stone by day, warriors by night,
They were betrayed by the humans they had sworn to protect,
Frozen in stone by a magic spell for a thousand years.
Now here in Manhatten.
The spell is broken.
And they live again!
They are defenders of the night,

THEY ARE GARGOYLES!

The age of darkness has long passed and modern nights are filled
with danger, and something far more. The angels of the night are
collecting by some force or pull to the land called New York. While
most of the world below is blissfully unaware of the existance of
these creatures, a rare few are privilaged to this information. Some
call themselves friends to Gargoyles, while others have made it their
life's work to destroy them. Tension runs high between different
groups of gargoyles that have begun to form. Some seek to remain
hidden from the eyes of the humans, protecting from the darkness.
While others seem not to care if the humans discover their existance.
The followers of the old ways war against those who seek to destroy
the humans. The Quarrymen plot to destroy all gargoyles. Silent battles
in the night...
 
( Note: This game is Disney's Gargoyles based. It is fully operational
but the world is not totally built yet. Input is very welcome. )

Mud         : The Land of Terminus
Code Base   : [Circlemud] 3.1, modified
Telnet      : scynscapa.darkemud.com 4002
WWW         : http://scynscapa.darkemud.com
Description :

A growing medieval based MUD, we are seeking builders for the most 
part at this time. We are also open for player testers, but the 
thing we need most now is a larger building staff. Going for an all 
original world, we currently have only 4 stock zones, and even those 
will eventually be replaced. Theme will be largely medieval, so any 
builders would preferably be able to stay within theme. A large race 
selection offers more variety for areas, still needed are a few 
race hometowns. Quest areas are also welcomed, so anyone able to 
create a nice challenge are welcome also.

Opening to players once the world is large enough to support a 
small playerbase, so the more builders we have, the sooner we will 
be ready. Any questions are welcomed to be emailed, or stop in and 
speak to Scynscapa or Rayen.

Player testing is welcome, but we are not yet ready for players. At 
least one more playerfile wipe will be necessary. However, testers 
will have a few advantages upon opening. Playtesters are needed to 
check zones for errors and balance, as well as to aid the testing 
of new features; hence the testers will have an advanced knowledge 
of the MUD when we are ready for players.

Mud         : RUST
Code Base   : [MUSH] TM 3.0p2
Telnet      : rust.exoteris.net 1800 [65.160.204.132]
WWW         : http://rust.exoteris.net/
Description :

  This is an amalgam of ideas that have collected in various
dusty corners over the years. Finally, after many false starts
I am picking up the pieces, and putting them all in one place in
the hopes that they will mesh well, and be joined by new ideas
which will all flourish together. This is an attempt to make the
most of the environment, from both a technical and creative
standpoint. There's no one particular genre or theme; an attempt
will be made to support a variety of atmospheres, allowing for
crossover where feasible and desired, and providing boundaries
where necessary. The only requirements here are an open mind and
the ability to respect.

Mud         : MEM - Middle Earth Mud
Code Base   : [Circlemud] Heavily Modified CircleMUD 3.1
Telnet      : mem.zapto.org 4000 [66.72.38.22]
WWW         : http://mem.zapto.org
Description :

Middle Earth Mud is a Multi-User Dungeon (MUD) based on Tolkien's
Middle Earth. It is a text world in which players can create a 
character and then play it as if it were truely Middle Earth. It 
is set after Bilbo has returned from Erebor (after the events of 
The Hobbit) and before he leaves the Shire after his party (before 
the events of The Lord of the Rings). It is completely free to play. 
It was built by Tolkien fans for Tolkien fans.

Middle Earth Mud's mission statement is to create an accurate and
realistic representation of Tolkien's Middle Earth, as close as may
be done in a MUD environment. Roleplaying is strongly encouraged. 
Out of character play, while tolerated to a certain level, is 
strongly discouraged. There is a war between the forces of the Dark 
Lord and the Free Peoples of Arda.

Currently MEM is centered around Bree and Breeland.  Players may 
choose to play a Dunadan man, Eriadorian man, Black Numenorean,
Dunlending, Dwarf or Hobbit.  Black Numenoreans and Dunlendings 
are in league with Mordor.  There are currently about 14 zones 
open with about 1500 rooms.  MEM's playerbase is virtually
non-existent right now.  We are working on building one.  Come 
join us and be the foundation of our player base!

MEM is not just a hack and slash MUD.  Should players choose they 
may learn a craft and aquire a building in Bree to be their shop.
Warriors, rangers and thieves may also aquire buildings to be their
homes or to be used for whatever they like.

We are currently hiring dedicated builders who will work hard and
finish what they start. The world will continue to grow slowly
unless we have devoted builders who love Tolkien.  The current 
building team can only build so fast.  Manwe can write brilliant
code until his fingers fall off, but with out a well built and large
world, there is no where for players to enjoy that code.  So, if you
love building and love Tolkien come build with us!

Upon entering the world, be on the lookout. What you knew is no longer
there. Places you visited yesterday are gone or moved a whole continent 
away. Things you held this morning have been swept away in the tidal wave of 
violence that will be known as the Great Disaster.

New races are being born as we speak, magic is coming alive in ways never 
dreamed possible. Technology and magic now co-exist in a place that knew 
only how big the next person's blaster was.

So, join us as we mourn the lives lost in the cataclysmic war, and focus on 
bringing new life into a world that was quickly dying away. 

If your will is strong enough to create something from  nothing, join us 
in our struggle to bring to life a new world.

Mud         : FlipSide Muck
Code Base   : [MUCK] Derived from Fuzzball 5.64
Telnet      : muck.flipsidemuck.org 9999 [66.92.223.139]
WWW         : http://flipsidemuck.org/
Description :

FlipSide is a Multiple-World Environment, bringing together
diverse and interesting cultures for a different roleplay
experience. While inter-world travel is discouraged,
central gathering points for all the characters to relax
OOC make for an interesting and colorful mix. :)

Currently, FlipSide has six active worlds:
El Dogrado - Set in an Aztec-themed environment, with dogs!
Fur City - OOC world for settling back and relaxing
Irken Invasion - New world based on Invader Zim
Pridelands - World based on The Lion King
Realms of Bastet - An anthropomorphic version of
Ancient Egypt, complete with gods and goddesses
Tir a' Turlach a Deigh - Tir is a fantastical
world with a Robin Hood/Medieval flavor.

All worlds except Fur City are IC roleplay-based worlds
with it's own unique culture, flavor and storyline.
FlipSide is a PG-rated muck with emphasis on roleplay, not
conflict. Check the web page for more information.

Mud         : Sleepless Nights
Code Base   : [Aber] Aber
Telnet      : sleepless.cheese.org 6789 [212.1.134.101]
WWW         : http://sleepless.cheese.org/
Description :

Welcome to the inflamed world of Sleepless Nights, an
exciting world of swords and sorcery set in medieval times.
Full of mystical dragons, knights, wizards and omnipotent
gods, you use your brains and brawn to survive the
mysteries of the land and become Immortal.

Sleepless Nights is a well established Aber5 mud based on
blizzard.uni but with extensive source enhancements and
significant universe growth to improve the game and make it
more unique. Important features are:-

  * Newbie friendly environment.
  * 7 guilds: Adventurer, Mage, Dark Priest, Nature Priest,
    Assassin, Warrior, Thieves + Vampire in development.
  * Points and puzzle-based progression through the game.
  * 18+ quests ranging in difficulty.
  * Player Killing and Stealing are allowed.
  * Offensive and defensive magic system.
  * Highlander system for no-risk pk bonus points.
  * Comprehensive web site containing game support.

Mud         : SlothMUD III
Code Base   : [Dikumud] Heavily Modified
Telnet      : slothmud.org 6101 [69.64.36.225]
WWW         : http://slothmud.org/
Description :

For 15 years, SlothMUD III has been one of the most successful MUDs of
its kind. Sloth is a heavily modified Diku which offers a unique world
of more than 20,000 rooms, inhabited by 8,000 people and creatures. 
 
In SlothMUD III, each player advances in four classes chosen from 
bard, cleric, druid, mage, monk, necromancer, thief, and warrior. 
In addition to the skills and spells of his basic four classes, our 
multi-class system provides special powers to each "prime" class. As 
a result, the hundreds of possible class orderings have distinct play 
styles. Once a player reaches maximum level in his four initial 
classes, a prestigious fifth class opens up which gives him entirely 
new skills and powers as well as access to a dangerous but rewarding 
expert-level continent. 
 
Sloth provides its immortals with a unique scripting language, 
allowing them to build areas that are interactive to an unprecedented 
degree. These areas include complex puzzles, hundreds of scripted 
quests, and monsters that behave in surprising and intelligent 
ways.  Several areas provide more than simple hunt-and-kill; 
these include a PvP arena and a coliseum where the player can 
test his mettle against an ever-nastier series of monsters. 
 
SlothMUD III also offers a very active immortal and administrative 
staff, constantly working to provide new and interesting experiences 
to challenge players. We are one of the most newbie-friendly MUDs 
around, with many experienced players willing to assist you in
learning and enjoying our game. We look forward to seeing you soon!

Mud         : SMiLE
Code Base   : [Aber] Heavily modified iDiRT derivation
Telnet      : smile.ath.cx 6715 [24.194.53.8]
WWW         : http://www.smile.ath.cx/
Description :

   SMiLE is an abermud which supports player killing.  The
object of the game is to obtain 30+ quest points and get
200,000 points to make wizard.  Points can be gained by
solving puzzles and quests, killing mobiles and other
players (if you have the killer flag) and dropping items of
value in one of the two sacrificial pits.

The type of character you play is your choice. You may
choose to run a killer, play nice and merely defend
yourself when attacked, or something in between.  Playing
the mud as a player killing mud will increase the challenge
you experience while running.  Player killing also gives
you the opportunity to try to outwit human players who are
less predictable than computer generated mobiles. You also
have the choice of playing the mud as a nonplayer killing
mud.  Which ever style you choose to play, the mobiles of
SMiLE are more challenging than in some other muds.  The
game has a complete combat system with weapons, armor and
spells.  Weapons and armor are abundant and with a bit of
exploration you can increase your magical knowledge.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Renegade's Ascension
Code Base   : [Dikumud] heavily modified
Telnet      : brighteyes.stacken.kth.se 4000 [130.237.234.83]
WWW         : 
Description :

Renegade's Ascension - The mortals paradise

History/Background:
Renegade's Ascension, which first was a part of BurningMUD 
before BurningMUD gods decided that the MUD had to split 
into two different MUD's due to different reasons,  is now 
a forwardgoing and developing MUD on it's own. The MUD is 
a non-playerkilling-MUD based on DIKU. All players on 
Renegade's Ascension lives under the same roof -Everyone 
got the same 
hometown - Moonglade.
 
Leveling-system:
Renegade's Ascension's leveling-system is made up that you, 
first off, gain experience to level 50 as a single-classed 
character and therefrom you Multi class. Multi classing 
means that you choose a second class and startover as a 
level 1/50, let us say, Magician(second-class)/Templar
(first-class), this means that you can use all the 
spell-abilities Magicians and Templars has - except those 
who are for pure classed only - Templar/Templar e.g. 
However, when being Multi classed you can only gain 
1/3 of the amount max experience that you could gain 
when you were single classed. Things become more 
even when reaching to 50/50 though since then the max 
experience barrier disappears and you can begin to Meta. 
Meta means that you buy stats instead of levels, Metas 
however, costs BOTH exp and gold and you NEED to buy a 
fixed amount of stats until you can gain another level. 
The amount of stats needed to be bought depends on what 
class you are.

The Well:
The Well is a place where you can gain frags and more cash 
than you can in experience-groups, frags is something you 
need if you want to upgrade your race - Little is actually 
known about these powerful beings except that they command 
great energies with an ease unheard of in current times. 
In some tales these beings are being referred to as the 
"K'ta'viir" - which literally means 'lords of essaence' 
in the Iruaic tongue. Being a K'ta'viir can benefit you 
in many ways, for an example, you can invoke different 
Orbs turning to Auras that benefits your character 
depending on what kind of Orb it is, there is also other 
special features for the K'ta'viir, but we think that you 
should explore that on your own. The Well is based on 25 
levels, starting at level one - getting harder for each 
level, however, more frags can be found in the 
well-creatures-corpses if they're on level 25 than if they 
are on level one. The Well contains many different 
monsters, everything from a cloaker to a mighty Balrog. 
Orbs for the K'ta'viirs can also be found inside the Well.

Code Base   : [LP] Driver: CD.04.06 Lib: CD.01.00 (modified)
Telnet      : eternaloasis.net 5011 [24.116.219.10]
WWW         : None
Description :

       Welcome to Eternal Oasis, soon to be the realm that will  
quench your thirst for both an excellent atmosphere of roleplay 
as well as a well developed multi-user environment.  Eternal Oasis 
is a multi-user dungeon in it's infancy.  We have a great base of  
coders that are helping to create a wonderfully detailed and well 
coded world to explore. 
      
       Our story begins in a world that resembles Earth, but one 
which houses many things that defy our own reality.  The realms of 
Eternal Oasis are at a dawning of a new age.  A great catastrophe  
broke the world and scattered the reminants into small secluded groups, 
where they grew and changed in seclusion.  Now, centuries have passed,  
civilizations are on the rise and sea traffic is starting up, new  
discoveries are being made, races strive for survival and others  
venture into hazardous territories to uncover things that have been 
lost to the past under the ruins of ancient kingdoms.

      Our theme is medieval fantasy, however we are very carefully 
reaching into new levels of fantasy which other muds have failed to 
achieve, whilst also keeping a tight hold on reality, all resulting in 
a very interesting twist which offers roleplayers an excellent  
environment to enjoy.

Description :

Our additions to the code are focussed mainly on improving the believability

Mud         : DreamScapes MMOFRPG
Code Base   : [Circlemud] heavily modified
Telnet      : dreamscapes.dyn.dhs.org 4500
WWW         : http://www.dreamscapes.dyn.dhs.org/ds2
Description :

DreamScapes MMOFRPG
 
 A Massively MultiPlayer Online Fantasy RolePlaying Game that
conjures up a spectacular gaming experience for all its
players. Step into a wonder filled world and interact with
people and monsters from all over the Realm! Battle mighty foes
or seek to influence the political and religious balance ...
choose your fate.

 DreamScapes MMOFRPG is a text based adventure game that is
free to play and is played by many people all at the same time.
Within the game you develop a fantasy character that can
interact with all the other players and many non-player
characters, you can also explore the huge world that makes up
DreamScapes.  As you explore you will discover all sorts of
cities, villages, quests, guilds, items, magic, and monsters!
All these aspects of the game are beautifully crafted in
colourful text with storybook like descriptions. The aim of the
game is to increase in power and prestige within the realm, as
such the ability to roleplay your chosen character is important
because with good roleplaying you will soon become well
renowned and respected. 

 When you join the game you will be asked to create a
character.  After that process has been completed you will
enter the realm and your character will also be created on the
games WebSite.  Then you can log in to both the game and this
site with the same name and password. Full access to the site
proves useful as you can join the community to seek advice,
learn more about the game, exchange ideas and participate in
organised in-game events.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : SpheresMUX
Code Base   : [MUSH] TinyMUSH 3
Telnet      : spheresmux.net 7777 [24.42.209.74]
WWW         : http://www.spheresmux.net
Description :

   Spheres is a role playing environment very loosely related to Jack L. 
Chalker's Well World series.  Essentially the game world consists of an 
infinite plane of spheres, and  within each sphere is a snapshot of a
different realm.  

For example, there is a sphere in which gryphons rule over their medieval
jungles, and another in which centaurs are making the dangerous traversal 
from the nuclear age to the information age.  Focus is made upon the
interaction of travelers migrating across different, foreign spheres.
Players are encouraged to develop their own tinyplots, or even conceive
and design their own spheres to add on to the game.  This is a solidly in
character environment; if your looking for a place to hack and bash, or be
all-powerful this isn't the game for you.  There is no combat system, and
no plans to ever develop one.  

We consider ourselves very newbie friendly, and are willing to spend the
time to help familiarize people with our theme.  All that is necessary to
play in the game is to have read the news files pertaining to our theme
'news theme' and the info files regarding your species.  (Type 'info'.)
If your interested in serious, exciting role play then come on out and
welcome!  Others should apply elsewhere. :>

Mud         : Split Infinity
Code Base   : Heavily modded Nightmare IVr4
Telnet      : si.nu 4000 [195.26.32.26]
WWW         : None
Description :

   Split Infinity is a mud of a wide variety of themes,
stretching across multiple planets.  The 3D space supports
spacecraft and even combat, similar to the 3D ocean system.
Mechs will be used among the elite in futuristic warfare,
matched evenly by the gurus of magic and psionics.  Melee
combat is further improved by the martial arts, mastering
deadly combinations of moves to defeat ones opponent.

   There are no classes, but instead a huge list of skills.
Skills will need to be reinforced in training to retain 
mastery.  There will, however, be guilds, which players may
join and gain valuable allies, perhaps dangerous enemies.
There is a large selection of races, some of the common
ones being split up into subraces, each with their own  
statistics, some with inheritted skills and resistances,
were creatures actually being able to morph as well.  

   If you want to be a part of a well-written,
revolutionary mud, we do still recruit programmers and
teach non-programming good writers with a simple
application process.  If interested, telnet si.nu 4000
then type 'help coding' after creating a character.

Description :

 Rancor is a highly-modified ROM 2.4, medieval fantasy,
role-playing-encouraged MUD.  Our mud is stable, and has
been so for over 3 years.  As stated above, we highly 
encourage role-playing, but we don't enforce it, making our 
mud ideal for anyone, role-player or not.  We have a
brand new quest system, created specially by our best 
coder.  We offer player killing and player stealing.  We 
also offer clans; however, because we do not force you to 
join a clan, the choice to kill/steal from other players 
and to be killed/stolen from is yours.  We have an arena of 
sorts, in which you can either have a 'bloodbath' with 
multiple people, or can fight one on one, regardless of 
whether you are in a clan or not.  Furthermore, we have 
extended race selection, giving plenty of freedom in
that department, as well as several rounded classes.  As if 
all this isn't enough, we'll soon be coming out with a 
brand-new mud (oddly enough, it's being called Rancor II) 
that is coded much cleaner and will have better routines 
and systems, such as a new combat system.

We've been receiving a number of new or returning players, 
as well.  We hope you'll be one of them!

Telnet      : swmud.org 6666 [208.170.78.46]
WWW         : http://www.swmud.org
Description :

 A mud based 100% on Star Wars, consisting of around 40 
large planets and space stations, including Kashyyyk, 
Corellia, Tatooine, Endor etc.
 
 We have 10 guilds: scientist, jedi, pilot, smuggler, 
mercenary, bounty hunter, diplomat, slicer, assassin and 
merchant. Each guild comes with an average of 25 unique 
skills. Player can choose three guilds for their character.
 
 There are 17 races, such as Wookiee, Jawa and Ewok. Each 
race comes with two unique race skills and bonuses.
 
 We have movable vehicles, ranged combat and an extensive 
space combat system. You can also build your own ship that 
is stored safely when you are not playing.
 
 The mud has newsgroups for the players to post ideas and 
discuss various things about the mud. Quests are not 
required for advancement. Help files are very extensive and 
a special newbie simulator with several areas helps new
players to get started.
 
Players can become wizards after reaching levels 15/10/10.

WWW         : http://rfc.mushpark.com
Description :

    Although RIFTs is a highly combat and power oriented RPG, Rise From Chaos is about
building relationships and telling entertaining stories, while exploring a fantasy life in a
science fiction setting. Tolkeen is a frontier kingdom, a haven for those who would be
persecuted elsewhere for their differences. The city-state is itself one link in a short
chain of alliances, their goal - survival against the many enemies at the doorstep: the
Coalition (a human supremacist, military organization); predatory dimensional beings
(D-Bees); supernatural entities whose thoughts and purposes are too alien to comprehend; as
well, humanity's own personal demons, living amongst and within - ignorance, power-lust, and
vice.

    The PCs of RfC live in a dangerous and mysterious world. Tolkeen's own secrets, of her
origin and her survival, are yet to be discovered. Should you choose to take part, your
impact upon this enduring quest will enrich the story today, and the story still untold.

    The kingdom has been built to allow extensive travel outside the main city, offering
many varied environments for storytelling. This MUSH is ideal for self-motivated writers
with good attitudes and keen wits.

Mud         : 8bitMUSH
Code Base   : [MUSH]
Telnet      : 8bit.memoryleak.org 4201 [24.9.122.236]
WWW         : http://8bit.memoryleak.org
Description :

* Building -- Free building, and lots of it. No quota. No theme. Build your
own little house, castle, swamp, or area.
* Exploring -- You'll find a variety of explorable areas including an
extensive mountain area, a Super Mario Bros. area, and many player homes
and lots. Players are often building new places to explore.
* FANSI Art -- We support FLAG Extended Ansi Settings which provides for
an extended character set: card suits, box drawing characters, and shading
characters allowing for many pseudo-colors. Re-live the days of BBS art.
* Coding -- We offer a ton of softcode to play with, including a playable
MUSH Nintendo (with Tetris, Frogger and Mario Brothers), mapping droids
for keeping track of places you've explored, and a whole slew of other
code. We offer support for those looking to learn how to code. This
includes player tutors, a 22-lesson coding tutorial, and plenty of unique
functions.
* Socializing -- We have a standard chat system where people can interact
from anywhere on the MUSH. If you don't like to do anything but socialize
that's fine with us.
* Capitalism -- We have a company system and stock market which promotes
the sales of goods and the competition of MUSH companies. Many of them sell
products and compete for your daily paycheck. You can also invest in
companies and attempt to make a profit.

of Many Things, The Rod of Seven Parts and other, original

gain levels like players. Role playing is encouraged but not
enforced.

disappearance...

Welcome to the universe of Quark. We are an ambitious group aiming to
build a MUD that intrigues and challenges its players. We refuse to be
bound by the restrictions of others. Developed from scratch in Java,
our cutting-edge infrastructure allows for the creation of a unique
gaming environment--including such characteristics as as a grid-based,
phased strategic combat system. Our custom browser-launched client
enables a degree of feature-rich integration not possible with other
MUDs.

check up on our progress, try out the client, and connect to our
server.  We are looking for people to help plan game mechanics, refine
story ideas, and begin building; or if you're a sophisticated player,
join us for upcoming test phases to help make Quark the greatest MUD
ever created.

Mud         : SumuMud
Code Base   : [LP] MudOS
Telnet      : sumu.org 3000 [194.100.161.23]
WWW         : http://www.sumu.org/
Description :

 SumuMUD is a Finland based mud, founded 1996 and based on fantasy genre,
on a structure of multiguild, universal skill & spell system and multiple
races. SumuMUD is an equipment mud, where one of the goals of the game is to
gain good equipment, that can be saved through reboots in rental lockers or in
castles.

 Co-operating with other players is encouraged, as the players can not solve
most of the quests just by themselves, but need an organized party. Players can
build castles where they can store equipment. The castles are fully
customizable, allowing custom descriptions, and guards, traps, doors and other
items. Examples of guilds players can join are fighters, berserkers, priests,
magicians, sorcerers, necromancers, abjurers and so on.

 Player killing is allowed for certain limits if the killer has a valid
reason. Generally, the world of SumuMUD is is a complex place where you act as
you would act in real life in similar environment.

Mud         : Blood Dusk
Code Base   : [Circlemud] Heavily modified
Telnet      : mud.dusk.org 7000 [67.19.101.51]
WWW         : http://mud.dusk.org/
Description :

The most unique mud on the Internet returns in its fourth version.
On Dusk you'll find...

- Dark pre-industrial theme
- All areas 100% original and unique to Blood Dusk
- A slot-based skill group system which allows detailed character
  customization while avoiding the 'jack of all trades' syndrome
- A unique combat system with hundreds of distinct moves, four
  stats (pain, fatigue, unbalance, and fear), and finishing moves
- Distinctive fighting styles including brawler, fencer, soldier,
  taoken, gladiator, berserker, knifer, staff fighter, wardancer
- Non-combat skill groups including theology, stealth,
  witchcraft, beastmastery, craftsmanship, medicine, apocruphyc
- Player-run factions which can build fortresses, hire NPC
  assistants, collect treasure, and ally and declare war
- Expansive home city of Ravenfall (~500 rooms)
- Hundreds of special abilities to customize your character, such
  as beer belly, stoicism, cloak of night, and eldritch aura

Dusk is also refreshingly free of annoying mud-isms such as rent,
corpse retrieval (combat is non-fatal), hunger & thirst, and
arbitrary command delay.  Every element in the game is designed for
exactly one thing: to enhance the fun of your experience!

If you're tired of trolls, hobbits, magic missle, bash, and glowing
jewel-bedecked swords of uberpower, then this is the mud for you.

We also have a focus on making it easy for players without a lot of
time to devote to the game to play and still find it enjoyable.  Of
course there are plenty of "elder games" for those that do have a lot
of time to spend.  Dusk accomodates many styles of play.  It's even
possible to play a character with no combat skills whatsoever.

Now six years old, Dusk's diverse playerbase is as friendly as they
are devoted.  Log on today and see what you've been missing.

WWW         : http://www.stickmud.org
Description :

  StickMUD is a fairly traditional LPMUD. It still carries
some features of the origianl LPMUDs, but most of the game 
is unique to Stick. StickMUD has been around over 10 years 
now, and still has some of its original or early coders and 
players around. This tightly knit group creates the 
athmosphere of StickMUD.

StickMUD has no real level or stat limits for your 
character. Your character can evolve forever, though, the 
higher levels can be very difficult to reach. In fact, 
StickMUD was one of the first, if not the first, LPMUD to 
extend the 20-level playing experience.

Stick has a number of distinct races and guilds to choose 
from. Each guild has its loyal supporters and favorite 
races. Guild wars and disputes are fairly common, since we 
allow limited player killing and fairly liberal self 
governance for players.

StickMUD has a loyal group of supporters who keep playing 
year after year, but the game is easy for newbies as well.
You are welcome to play with us.

NOTE: We are currently adding new areas and a new universal
skill system.

Mud         : Tempora Heroica
Code Base   : [Circlemud] Archipelago
Telnet      : titan.ibiblio.org 2895 [152.2.210.122]
WWW         : http://www.ibiblio.org/TH/
Description :

 Tempora Heroica is a free-to-play, text-based online game known to most people
as a MUD or multi-user dungeon. The mud has over eight years of development and
has many things that distinguishes it from other online games, including a magic
system based on Ars Magica and a detailed, well-written, scratch-built fantasy
game world that has a quirky, small-town atmosphere and is filled with colorful
players and NPCs.

Tempora Heroica has several features to assist new and first-time players,
Such as an expansive in-game help system that is constantly being updated and
expanded and a on-demand mapping system that provides a 9x9 grid of the
surrounding area. For players who enjoy diversity, TH has many races available
for play: humans, halflings, giants, trolls, ogres, gnomes, dwarves, goblins,
elves, selkies, pixies, and brownies.

Additionally, the experienced mudder that is looking for a new home will find
play on TH rewarding. Not only have the normal things that you can find on
every-other-mud been added, such as houses, customizable color, dynamic socials
for enhanced role-play, and stackable aliases. But, what really makes this MUD
different, is its hard-working staff that really sweats the little details that
makes the MUD come to life!

as well. We have a restricted PK system, only those signing the 
Book of Blood are allowed to PK and even then it's only within 7 
levels. We have a variety of clans as well as an Arena for some 
old-fashioned bloodbath fun (minus the looting and XP loss). 

If you wish to try an old mud with a new attitude,  we are sure you 
will not be disappointed.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : Starlane: The Arcturus Game
Code Base   : [Custom] Requires custom Java client
Telnet      :  
WWW         : http://hexehyl.snt.utwente.nl/starlane/
Description :

   Starlane is an abstract, multi-player, network, real-time,
persistent-world strategy game of intersteller empire-building and
diplomacy. Starlane players take on the role of leaders of a galactic
power group, issuing commands to units such as starships, bases and
armies in order to achive their chosen goals; be they survial,
prosperity or galactic domination.

While player's orders are processed in real time and take effect
immediately, Starlane was designed to be played over an extended period
of time, with negotiations between players occuring through e-mail. The
ideal Starlane game would involve tens (or hundreds) of players,
thousands of star systems, and the kind of Byzantine diplomacy that
would make Kofi Annan want to curl up and die.

Starlane requires the download of a custom Java client.

Mud         : ThunderDome
Code Base   : [Dikumud] tdome v.3
Telnet      : tdome.net 5555 [216.161.219.114]
WWW         : http://www.dark-one.net/tdome/
Description :

  Entering its 12th year of existence, ThunderDome can now boast of being one
of the longest running MUDs in the history of the internet.  In those years,
ThunderDome has done much to advance the quality of game play, while adding
much to the notions of what a diku-style mud should be. Tdome offers a dark,
and at times, humorous perspective on a futuristic world set sometime after
the earth's destruction. Human society,  formed mostly of roughly governed
gangs, must now contend with aliens and mutated beasts for control of tdome's
13k rooms. Toward that end, players can choose between 13 different classes,
and are allowed to log 3 of these characters on at once.

Guns (dozens are offered) and magic vie for superiority in the tdome
world, while biological implants and learned skills offer additional methods
by which a character might improve his lot in a life filled to the brim with
danger and adventure. Inexperienced players soon learn that the inherent
danger can be tempered by joining one of tdome's many gangs which offer a
variety of advantages. Sanctioned gangs have their own bunkers from which
to operate, and which offer cut rate rent costs and equipment repair.

If you are the sort that enjoys walking on the wild side, come seek the
challenge of survival in a world gone mad. There should be plenty of room
to accommodate you...Hell ain't half full yet. :)

  There are many, many worlds out there. Some are driven by magic, others by

something will get lost and drift away, whether out of careless neglect or 
planned destruction... These lost fragments of worlds - places, things, and 
people who have lost their way - drift for undefined time until they reach 
the point at the bottom of the universe. The cosmic lint trap. The Strange 
Attractor. 

Strange Attractor is a MUSH intended for people who want a place where IC 
anonymity is enforced, role-playing is high quality, and nearly anything is 
possible. Come hang out as a Guest for a while and you'll pick up what the 
place is really about - that no matter where you're from or who you are, 
you're part of the community of the Attractor. Although all characters are 
reviewed to make sure they're not imbalancing, all character types are 
welcome to come make up a world where where everything works, where anything
is possible, and where nobody is going home again.

   Top Mud is an LPMud using a Shattered World game driver.
It was established around 1992 at UTSA and has survived
with many of the original castles and mudlib components.

Top Mud will challenge you with interesting, unique
quests.  You can join guilds to get extra powers.  Special
attributes (strength, toughness, spell skill) improve your
character.  Weather, time, and food/hunger are part of the
game.  There are lockers for rent to store your equipment
when you quit, and there is a credit union (with ATM) to
save your money.

In addition to the traditional medieval/fantasy flavor,
there are creative areas and monsters, such as: Camelot and
Sherwood Forest; Nolan Ryan and baseball trading cards;
Mervyn the Apothecary and his green cheese; cartoon, comic
book, and story book monsters; Aquarena Springs' Ralph the
Swimming Pig; Lonestar, the IRIX computer at UTSA; Ahab the
Arab; Elvis and the Japanese Tourist; Vampire of the Sacred
Blood; the highlander immortal Rameriez; and sand goblins.

Mud         : Dragonball: End Game
Code Base   : [Rom] DBA v2 Heavily Modified
Telnet      : reign.sytes.net 1025 [68.103.136.132]
WWW         : None
Description :

After a breif hiatus, the End Game is back!  
End Game is a Roleplay Enforced mud with many 
diffrent ways a player can develop their character.  
We offer over 16 diffrent races, each with their 
own strengths and flaws.  Each race also has their
own unique attacks and special abilites, so no two
characters will ever be the same.  Powerlevel is 
based on how well a player trains, with the player 
choosing which rout to take.  Either a super strong 
Saiyan, or a lighting quick Android, the player makes
their own choices.

End Game also provides one of the most unique aspects
of roleplay...Sagas.  Sagas are a HUGE roleplay where
all players will have the chance to prove their strength.
Sagas are the most advanced types of roleplay, where 
characters can choose to fight for the good, or the evil.
Sagas all depend on how the players react to their environemnt.
We also provide automated quests and randomly ran Immortal 
quests, so players will always have a chance to roleplay to
their fullest.

So if your looking for a friendly, mature roleplay enviornment,
End Game is the place for you to be at.

We hope to see you soon!
-End Game Staff

Description :

   TravMud has been around since fall 1991 and is a long-running,
stable environment.  Using a highly modified 2.4.5 mudlib,
we have created a fun environment without the complexities
involved with many of today's newer systems.  Though an older
system, we offer many features to increase a player's fun.
A guild system exists that allows players to specialize
their character's abilities, as they explore the world of
TravMud through our many areas.  These areas span from
medieval fantasy to science fiction, but still manage to
keep those areas seperate.  We have a few, very challenging
quests which are only required for advancement to creator
status.  Player Killing is by registration only, with registered
players fighting amongth themselves without limit.  Finally, we
have a responsive wizard staff who are open to suggestions
for improvement, and are currently working on cleaning up some
of the more pernicious bugs, and making the MUD more navigable.
Come by and see TravMud.  See how much fun simplicity can be
for a change.

                -----------------------------------------------

Mud         : TrekMUSH - Among The Stars
Code Base   : [MUSH] PennMUSH 1.7.4 patchlevel 20
Telnet      : ats.trekmush.org 1701 [207.206.171.31]
WWW         : None
Description :

 ATS is set 25 years past DS9's Way of the Warrior episode,
however many canon events have been incorporated into the
timeline.
 
The MUSH has 8 active factions: UFP, Klingons, Romulans,
Cardassians, Ferengi, Pryan (Maquis) and Orions.
 
The MUSH also includes a new original faction known as the
Zhrakhadi Orders.
 
There are many NPC controlled factions, ranging from the canon
Borg, Hirogen, Kazon, Dominion and Tholians as well as original
NPC empires Aurellans, Tyrixx, Veridan and Galactic Terran
Imperium.
 
ATS is the home of Aspace, which is a complete and fully-
featured space system. There are also full economy and combat
systems, all being constantly upgrading to further enhance the
gameplay.
 
There are also a number of features in space including nebulae,
anomalies, planets, bases and ships. Each faction also has its
own unique race and ship attributes.
 
ATS is not a mud. ATS is a Role Playing MUSH. You will need to
RP in order to gain rank, access to ships or to fully
experience all that ATS has to offer. You must earn rank and
standing by RPing your way to the top - there is competition,
so you must be the best.
 
ATS invites all applicants to come and enjoy the vast universe
that ATS has to offer.

Mud         : Turf
Code Base   : [Merc] Heavily modified: http://www.turf.org/MercComparison.html
Telnet      : turf.org 4000 [212.87.84.207]
WWW         : http://www.turf.org
Description :

  Turf is a multi-themed MUD with entirely unique areas ranging from
'Two-Tier Britain', a then-and-now look at the UK, to future-oriented
areas such as Space Station Krios and Star Wars, Star Trek, and
Babylon 5 areas, with everything in between from gothic horror to Monty
Python's Flying Circus, and several areas too unique to even describe
in under twenty lines.  65 areas in total, all of which have been carefully
checked for interesting content rather than sheer size.

PK is restricted to members of clans who have voted to be involved in
player-killing.  Player stealing is regulated in the same way.

Turf began as a Merc 2.2 in 1994 and has had an evolving code base
since, with a bent on stability as well as features.  In addition to the flashy
features found on all quality MUDs Turf adds stability, averaging under four
crashes in a year.  Turf is rebooted approximately once a month for code
and area file updates, so there is always something new to play with.

Mud         : The Twilight Reconquista
Code Base   : [Custom] TwilightMu* 0.2B
Telnet      : twilightreconquista.com 1234 [69.44.152.87]
WWW         : http://www.twilightreconquista.com/
Description :

 You have just stepped into a World of Darkness.  Here werebeasts are more
than tales for children and the undead haunt more than just your nightmares.
It is the Lord's Year 1246 and strife is afoot in Iberia.  Men squabble over
the cities of Cordoba and Seville, and outright war is coming closer by the
night.  History is being written, and now you are part of it.  You are part
of a much different history however, a history unknown to all but the most
eldritch mortals and ancient creatures of the night.  The battles between
the Christians and the Moors seem inconsequential when compared to the war
the is fought in the darkness.  The Brujah struggle in vain against the
Lasombra for control of Cordoba, while the Assimites prepare to defend the
streets of Seville against the combined forces of the High Clans.  To
complicate matters the werecreatures known as Garou are also staking their
claim to the area, hoping to prevent the corruption of the vast Iberian
wilderness.  Also of concern is the Inquisition, which is now afoot in
Cordoba and will no doubt soon spread to Seville.  History is being written
by the moment...  Is the pen in your hand, or are you reading the book?  

The Twilight Reconquista is based in the Kingdom of Castile, the area
that is currently Spain.  The game system in use is WhiteWolf's Dark Ages, 
which is used with permission.  We hope to bring you the closest
experience to tabletop gaming possible via a text based game.  This game 
contains no hard coded combat, no monster bashing, no find this/bring it
there questing, only true to table top RP gaming.

We currently have coded support for Dark Ages: Vampire, Dark Ages: Inquisitor 
and Dark Ages: Werewolf.

Mud         : Twilight
Code Base   : MUCK
Telnet      : twilight.tigerden.com 6010 [198.30.162.10]
WWW         : http://www.tigerden.com/~twilight/
Description :

   Twilight is a roleplay-intensive environment, whose pivotal
element is that of the myths and legends of creatures and
beings hidden from the human world but very much part of
it. Players should either make their characters into beings
that can appear as human, or at least as a normal animal
(such as a domestic dog or a sewer rat) in public, and
have a true nature somewhat more paranormal (ie: Vampire,
Werewolf, Mage, Faerie, etc.). Alternately, players can
also play true humans, who may or may not have some kind of
education in this strange world going on right beneath
their noses. The city is dark, techno-gothic, and should
have plenty of mystery.

To get a better feel for the MUCK, we recommend visiting
Twilight as a guest before you send email for a character.
Innovation and creativity are encouraged in both character
creation and tinyplot development! Players are allowed to
make up their own 'race' to accomodate their needs, so long
as it remains in theme and not overly powerful.

Mud         : Twilight LPMUD
Code Base   : [LP] MudOS v22.2b14 Nightmare MudLib
Telnet      : twilight-mud.no-ip.info 9999
WWW         : http://twilight-mud.no-ip.info:8888
Description :

   Twilight MUD. We have 8 guilds, 14 races, 40 subclasses
and lots of original and exciting areas.  We are constantly 
expanding with many new areas and new subclasses in the 
process of being coded.

Players can own their own houses and pubs. We offer cabals
where a cabal can rise from a Cabal Camp to a Cabal Kingdom
complete with its own currency! And if you get tired of 
mudding, we have games coded in the game itself, like poker,
blackjack! 

Sick of all the hash and slash? We are currently 
implementing an extensive crafts system. Fancy some fishing? 
You can either buy a fishing rod or you can made one 
yourself. Dig for some worms as bait, find a nice spot, and 
spend your day waiting for the fishes to bite. Want to grow 
your own crops? Just buy some seeds, look for an empty farm, 
throw down your weapons and become a farmer instead.

Every 2 1/2 hours players get to vote for war.  The wizards 
are a friendly and cheerful lot and are always available
to answer any questions. We have MUD gatherings once in a 
while where players and wizards gather to eat, drink and 
talk about mud. So feel free to drop by our mud and have 
a look.

Mud         : Shades of the Past
Code Base   : [GodWars] Dystopia heavily modified into an online tabletop
Telnet      : kaerlath.genesismuds.com 9969 [216.136.9.5]
WWW         : http://kaerlath.genesismuds.com
Description :

 Shades of the Past is a mud that is based upon the White
Wolf World of Darkness RPG system and we use the Dark
Ages books as our guidelines.  Our setting is Venice, Italy,
in the year 1230 A.D.

 We allow Vampire, Bete, Garou, and Mage characters
currently for our players.  More classes are being considered
in the future, with a possibility of perhaps Changeling and
Wraith.

 Our code is totally driven like a tabletop game, with
rolls being 90% dependant upon a Storyteller being involved
in a scene or chronicle.  Combat is not driven by mobs, nor
equipment, but by storyline and RP.  Each turn is rolled out
exactly by the rules as set forth by White Wolf Studios.

 We are a sister mud to Amaranth, but our code is significantly
different, being based upon Dystopia and the code redone
and recoded from scratch, as to save both space, size, and
memory requirements.

 More features include a system that is tied in with our web
pages, and help files that are dynamically created by the mud
and published to the web.

 If you're tired of the same Midgaard and want to try RPing,
give us a try!

Mud         : Strife Mud
Code Base   : [Circlemud] version 3.00 patchlevel 18
Telnet      : strife.betterbox.net 4100 [207.206.185.91]
WWW         : http://strife.betterbox.net/
Description :

   Strife Mud is loosely based on the Forgotten Realms
setting.  Characters are able to advance through 100 mortal 
levels and 20 additional remort levels. Remorts keep their 
old statistics and skills, but gain enhanced powers 
depending on the class.  Role playing is encouraged, but 
not required.   

  Spell casting is based on a memorization system instead 
of the usual mana system.  Classes include: arcanists, 
clerics, rogues, warriors, rangers, paladins, druids, 
bards, vampires, barbarians, and remort classes: monks, 
shield-dancers, blackguards, chosen, crusaders, assassins, 
and arch-mages.  Races include humans, elves, 
dwarves, half-elves, gnomes, illithid, giants, drow, 
halflings, and minotaurs.

  Various forgotten realms deities (from the time of 
Netheril) are available for worship, and determine which 
spells clerics receive.  There is also an arena in 
which players can fight without losing equipment or 
experience.  

  There are clanhalls with clan bank accounts, clan 
channels, healers, and personal guards.

  Strife is in beta at this time, so some features are in
the testing phase... suggestions are always welcome.  Quest
tokens are offered for writing help files.  The immortals
and players are friendly.  Come visit a growing mud with a
lot of potential.

Mud         : Stick in the MUD
Code Base   : [Rom] ROM 2.3
Telnet      : mud.stick.org 9000 [209.83.132.84]
WWW         : http://bb7.betterbox.net/~stick/
Description :

  Stick in the MUD, founded in February 1994, was one of
the first ROM-based MUDs online.  Originally a hangout
for displaced ROM players and University of Toronto
engineering students, it quickly became populated with
new mudders and evolved its own identity.

Stick attracts beginning and experienced mudders who are
looking for a simple, friendly, relatively clean ROM-based
mud to explore.  It retains mudders who enjoy the diversity
and spirit of community that endure year after year -- and
it retains mudders who just... can't... resist... the urge
to log on....

As a game, Stick in the MUD is much like its name.  It
doesn't change quickly.  This is not a 1000-area 80-race
MUD with 100 people on at all times.  The implementors
are a couple of boring ol' computer professionals who
try hard not to take the game, their roles, or themselves
too seriously.  They keep good backups, fix bugs, and
otherwise sit around and socialize like most everyone else.

For the player who prefers to keep running around killing
monsters after reaching immortality, Stick offers a
reincarnation option with expanded race/class selections.

 at present and eager for new players.

 4pm - 6am EST, but MUCK is open 24 hours. You can sign on and
 request a character by typing @request. If a character wizard is

 within 24-48 hours.

 on the entrance page.

Mud         : Alsherok
Code Base   : [AFKMud] Derived from Smaug 1.4a
Telnet      : alsherok.net 5500 [64.81.32.135]
WWW         : http://www.alsherok.net/
Description :

 Alsherok is a medieval/fantasy mud using the AFKMud 
codebase, which is derived from the SMAUG 1.02a/1.4a 
codebase. We have many features, such as:

* A unique character creation system where you create your character in play.
* Choose from 19 races and 11 classes.
* An original 9,000+ room world, connected by an extensive overland map system.
* A more realistic auction system with automated auctioneers.
* Variable display layouts for things like score, who, etc.
* Highly customizable ANSI color.
* Guilds for peaceful players, Clans for PK.
* Internal command aliasing.
* Mud eXtension Protocol (MXP) enhancements. [Requires client-side support]
* Mud Sound Protocol (MSP) enhancements. [Requires client-side support]
* MCCP compression to reduce outgoing bandwidth. [Requires client-side support]
* Integrated webserver supporting who, wizlist, areas list, and helpfile index.
* Intermud-3 and IMC2 chat network links.
* A staff of helpful, friendly immortals. Cliche, but at least it's true :)

Need more incentive? Drop by our webpage at www.alsherok.net.
It's full of helpful tips on playing on Alsherok and has a number of other
goodies such as a stories section.

There are a lot of things to see and do in Alsherok, and we hope to see you there!

Adventure beckons in the lands of mystique....
Samson - Implementor of Alsherok

Mud         : KorongilMUSH
Code Base   : [MUSH] Pennmush 1.7.4 patchlevel 6 - Korongil Mods 0.4
Telnet      : mush.korongil.org 6250 [204.116.114.80]
WWW         : http://www.korongil.org/
Description :

 Korongil is a world of fantasy, where demons and sorcerers battle knights and
kings. The darkness of evil Moralan is growing once more, and the forces of
light build their strength to rise up and oppose it. What will happen? Is war
inevitable? Within this struggle you will find common men and women who shall
rise to become legends, will you be one of them? Only time, and RP, will tell.
 
The theme of Korongil is a pseudo-medieval setting of fantastic proportions.
The struggle between good and evil is spread throughout all levels of
existance, from the lives of mortals, the world's nations, even to the deities
responsible for this reality. The tides of war and peace flow throughout the
past, present, and future, carrying the whims of mortals and immortals alike.
The essence of sorcery surrounds all that exists, offering its power to all who
have the strength to wield it. Fantastic creatures inhabit the wilds as the
sentient races build Korongil's nations within their cities. The path the world
will take relies upon the choices of those who struggle within its reality.
 
KorongilMUSH offers interesting Role-Playing within its original fantasy world.
You can portray one of the many inhabitants of this vast and varied world.
Select to play any of our standard races, from the dour dwarves to the brutish
xyloks, and perhaps earn the role of one of our more restricted species.
Explore the nations of Elduran and Moralan while taking part in the intrigues
and events that swirl around you. Your actions can shape the world. Justice or
tyranny, life or death, the choice is yours.

                -----------------------------------------------

Code Base   : [MUX]
Telnet      : mux.cruciblecity.net 4626 [67.130.96.226]
WWW         : http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/CrucibleCity/
Description :

        The inside of Alan Moore's head...

        ... or not. Crucible City MUX is an original-themed Supers 
MUX using the Mutants and Masterminds game system by Green Ronin. In 
the wake of a mysterious Event that stripped Earth of much of its 
preternatural heroes, a vacuum has been left: other heroes and 
villains can step up to take their places and carve out their own 
niche in the world's consciousness.

        At Crucible City, we enjoy telling stories, and our 
playerbase, while small, is growing. All players are encouraged to be
creative in their background stories, and to mesh with our game's 
continuity. We do not accept canon comic book characters, but we do 
characters with similar concepts to Marvel or DC canon characters.

Mud         : Unicorn Point MUSH

Telnet      : mux.net 4201 [207.96.40.62]
WWW         : http://www.mux.net/~unicornpoint/index.html
Description :

   The World of Caltar lies far distant from planet Earth, but in many ways it  
is very similar. The Caltar is at an age similar to Earth's medieval time, with
peasants, knights, lords, and kings. The men and women of Caltar have lived
their lives spread out over the vast continent of Eastland that has been divided
into several nations. Just recently, however, four ships set out in a voyage,
fleeing the oppression that they could see was beginning to develop at home.

During the trip across the ocean, the ships got separated, but one of them as
discovered a new continent to the west through sheer luck, a continent that is
large, or possibly larger than the Eastland. The people got out and began to   
explore, discovering the other half of the world that they barely knew. What
they have found, is a whole lot of surprises. For one thing, magic, long        
scoffed at by men as something that can only exists in a dreamer's fantasy,
has been found to exist, albeit in small occurrences, on the Western
Continent.

Floating on Caltar's blue oceans, the discovery of the Western Continent will
prove pivotal in the development of the men and women of the world, and a great
many stories will be created there. These are the stories of those people...

Mud         : Ansible
Code Base   : [MOO] LambdaMOO 1.8.0p5
Telnet      : ansible.org 6000 [63.202.230.6]
WWW         : None
Description :

 Ansible is a Role-Playing (non-combat, non-PK) Game set 10
years prior to the events depicted on the battle school
from Orson Scott Card's novel 'Ender's Game'.

 The players take on the roles of students on an
International Fleet space station and interact with each
other and the teachers.  Specially selected children
(chosen for their intelligence and determination) arrive
to the station as 'launchies', the low of the low newbies,
of approximately 6 years in age.

 Eventually, these students are promoted to 'armies' that
compete in battle games set up by the teachers.  Some of
these soldiers will become Toon Leaders.  A few,
Commanders.  By the time of graduation, at about age 14,
each child will have made many friends and a few enemies,
and learned the abilities they need to become skilled
soldiers, strategists, and pilots for the International
Fleet.

 That is, so long as the teachers don't break the young
recruits by pushing them too hard, desperate to discover
the child commander destined to lead Earth to victory
against a deadly alien race, the Formics.

web-based tool for doing so. The interface is entirely free of controls or

Mud         : VikingMUD
Code Base   : [Unknown] MudOS 20.23 patched for Viking
Telnet      : connect.vikingmud.org 2001 [129.240.67.246]
WWW         : http://www.vikingmud.org
Description :

   Viking runs on MudOS and offers several guilds (classes) for         
players, including for example Samurai, Monks, Frog (an
easy-to-learn guild mainly for newbies), Frost
(cold-hearted mages), and others. It is based in Norway,
and usually yields an average of 50 players connected at
a time. Players are separated into three main classes.

From lowest to highest, they are: mortals, eternals, and
wizards. Mortals are the newbies, eternals are more  
experienced players, and wizards are those who choose  
wizardry instead of becoming an eternal. Wizards cannot
interfere with game play, but are granted more sys
privileges and have the ability to code new areas for the
mud. It's a very structurally organized mud with friendly
people, and any user would enjoy it.

Mud         : Vincent's Hollow
Code Base   : [LP] MudOS v21.7-VH-980915
Telnet      : mud.vhdev.com 1991 [207.177.79.61]
WWW         : http://www.vhdev.com/
Description :

 Vincent's Hollow LPMUD, established on April 28, 1991, is one of the older
LPMUDs on the Internet.  Its founders come from the classic LPMUDs of the
1990-1991, such as SunMUD, SherlockMUD, GraniteMUD, Darker Realms, and
Shattered World.
 
 VH, as it is affectionately called by its players and  wizards, was
established with the simple principle of being different, at a time when a lot
of LPMUDs were constructed of the same stock world with a church, a humpedback
bridge, an orcs' cave, and Leo the Lion.  It was one of the first LPMUDs to
install a player-operated guild system, multi-class and skill system, and
advanced magic casting.  VH also focuses on other 'fun' factors other than your 
everyday 'role-playing'.  We have various on-line games you can play with your
fellow adventurers.  We also sponsor real life parties (most of them in Iowa)
where players and wizards from around the country come and join us couple times
a year to have real life fun (usually for Halloween and New Year).

overbearing or affecting game balance.

combat/experience system, we have tried to promote all of
what we feel are the best aspects of mudding in general.

system will allow players to take action against each other
where the game will not allow them to.

note to immortal within the mud, or via email
(escape@alcatraz.wolfpaw.net) if that is easier.

and write history. A continent of legends, both of the past
and in the making, where also you can become part of an 
endlessly unfolding tale. You may build your reputation and
become a respected or feared member of society. All the while
you are part of the unfolding history of a world in which you
can play a major or even guiding part. Choose between playing
good or evil and join neverending war between light and 
darkness.

War of Gods has many features to make the game more enjoyable.
Ansi color support, ansi graphical overland map connecting the
zones, ability to party with other players, many original 
features including spells, skills and abilities, learning
through use, huge manuals and help files and balanced races 
and classes

Mud         : Turnings of the Wheel
Code Base   : [Circlemud]
Telnet      : 68.16.173.101 4842
WWW         : None
Description :

 Turnings of the Wheel offers a new and exciting concept in
Role Playing.  Based on the Wheel of Time series by Robert 
Jordan, the mud is set a few years after the Fall of 
Malkier.  We offer full Rp experience here so it is 
possible to level your character without ever having to kill
a mob.  Skills can be practiced and learned all with 
roleplay as well.  A unique skill ranking system makes
it so that no two characters are the same, and allows for
individuality to be focused on.  A complete advantage and 
disadvantage further helps character development.  Creation 
can be a bit tricky, but take your time and read the
directions and it will be well worth the effort.  All Wheel
of Time clans and guilds are offered as well as sguilds and
noble houses.  If enough players are gathered Admin will
also consider customized guilds to suit Rp purposes.  The
staff is experienced and dedicated and has a non-
intervention policy regarding roleplay.  There is no
scripted RP here.  

 If you are a fan of the Wheel of Time series and enjoy
roleplay, then this is the place for you.  If your a Rp
fanatic and wish to immerse yourself in a total IC (in-
character) enviroment, you are more than welcome to give us
a try.  All in all, everyone is welcome.

features the land from Icewind Dale to Myth Drannor.

of new code and repairs to the Rot codebase.  We feature various
systems such as Ownable Airships, Editable Property, Automated Quests,
Banking, An Automated Arena with Mass Arena, and numberous things we
cannot even remember doing.

with things not for young eyes.  Those offended by sex, violence and

Mud         : Wheel of Time
Code Base   : [Circlemud] Circle
Telnet      : wotmud.org 2222 [12.14.84.254]
WWW         : http://www.wotmud.org/index.html
Description :

Open since 1993, WoTMUD IV, The Wheel of Time MUD is the most popular MUD 
based on the 'Wheel of Time' novels by Robert Jordan. 100% unique, you'll 
find no stock zones, mobs or features anywhere here. Our game philosophy 
is to leave the choice of the type of game that you wish to play up to you: 
we're a good old-fashioned mud with as few rules as is reasonably possible. 

o For pkillers, The Wheel of Time MUD is set amidst a three-way race war, 
  each race having its own defined 'homeland' and boundary. 
o For the explorer, The Wheel of Time MUD has more than 220 zones each 
  checked for accuracy against the books. No stock here at all.
o For roleplayers, The Wheel of Time MUD's 50 clans includes almost every 
  faction that you would expect to find in the books.
o For socialisers, The Wheel of Time MUD is a large, busy & talkative mud, 
  which peaks at more than 200 people connected!
o For adventurers, The Wheel of Time MUD has different, topical quests 
  for every clan with large global quests determining the fate of the world. 

WoTMUD IV was chosen as the Mud Connector's 'Mud of the Month' in June 1999. 
In the words of online critics, we are 'The Bee's Knees' (games.com, 1997), 
'The Internet at it's best' (freelaunch.com, 1999), 'A Killer World' 
(about.com, 1998),  and 'A Must See' (wheeloftime.org, 2000). Please visit 
our website at http://wotmud.org for more details =).

Description :

  Winterkill is an LPMud which started out in january 1997.
Since then the game has changed alot and is constantly
evolving with new features.

  Currently the players have 27 races and 12 guilds to
choose from, and are free to reincarnate to try out
different combinations. So there is a lot to explore.

  The world itself consists of 5 islands totalling 250 000
rooms. The islands are divided into areas which have
different stories and monsters etc. In addition there are
entrances to nearly a 100 areas from the large map.

  Players can do different kind of quests to gain levels
with lesser experience costs. You can choose to kill
monsters by yourself or in parties with your friends,
making the play more fun. Larger monsters can give good
equipment which can be worn to give different benefits in
form of boosted statistics and special abilities. The
equipment you make is saved for you to use or sell later
on. If you get rich you can build your own castle, buy a
horse to ride with or buy other things to show off with
your status ;)

  Playerkilling is not encouraged, since too much killing
will make you an outlaw - which are free prey to all!

  We also offer clan system where you can fight other clans
with parties. The good clans get bonuses for their success
in the clan wars.

  We are always ready to hear players' ideas and try to
make the best ones come true. Hope to see you online, come
play and have fun.

Mud         : 7th Sign
Code Base   : [LP] Custom driver and library
Telnet      : 7thsignmud.org 7000 [216.175.225.250]
WWW         : http://www.7thsignmud.org/
Description :

 Many years ago, a group of researchers at Miskatonic University sought to
harness the power of reality itself by delving more deeply into the atomic
structure than science had theretofore studied. Frustrated with the
limitations of normal equipment and methodoligies, the scientists borrowed
arcane occult techniques as well as highly unstable theoretical concepts
of physics, many of which had never been tested. The preparations for the
experiment were expeciently and concisely readied for the conjunction of
the planets of classic astrology -- Earth, Moon, Sun, Mars, Venus, Saturn,
and Jupiter. the test proceeded excedingly well initially; however as the
scientists probed further and further into the atoms' cores immense
quantities of energy accumulated well outside the expected range. The
resulting explosion destroyed the laboratory ... but what's more is that
it sent ryfts throughout the fabric of reality through which past, present,
and future collided -- and fantasy and fact became one in the same. Many
claim this is the 'Hell on Earth' foretold in Holy Scriptures -- those
responsible have never been heard from again, though some speculate that
they attained the power they sought to control. The city of Arkham itself
was spared in this merging of realms and has since become the only known
sanctuary left in a world changing constantly as the threads holding
reality together unravel more and more each day.

Mud         : Iindor u Taruiithron
Code Base   : [Dawn] [Dawn of Time Modified]
Telnet      : iindor.niconet2k.com 5555 [65.110.41.41]
WWW         : http://iindor.niconet2k.com/
Description :

Iindor u Taruiithron is a MUD based on the Dawn of Time codebase.
We are in the process of heavily modifying the code to add in
original code of our own as well as original areas. All of the
stock areas and some of the DoT commands have been removed, as
well as new ones installed. We are currently hiring builders to
assist us in this huge project. The ability to work well with
others is a definite plus, however, if builders want to hide in
their hole and not talk to anyone while they're building, that's
their perrogative. A firm knowledge of OLC is preferred, but not
necessary. (As much as we would like to teach, we just don't
always have the time). A minimum of 300 vnums per area has been
set. We will not be accepting areas smaller than this. All
builders will be given an immortal position and must be willing
to work regardless of the fact that there is no playerbase yet.
Because of the lack of original areas, we will not be opening the
MUD to players until we feel it is ready for the world. There is
no book or movie theme. The reason for this is so that it leaves
a lot open to the imagination for the builders, instead of restricting
it so 'this' or 'that' can't be put in.

We are wanting to make this place as original as possible, so keep
that in mind, please.

If you have any questions at all, please feel free to click on the
email link to contact us.

Please make sure you put 'Iindor u Taruiithron' in the subject line
of any e- mails regarding the MUD. Thanks and we look forward to
hearing from you.

Aarchon takes place in a realm where space, time, and 
reality itself have been shattered, leaving death dead and 
making all things possible. We have a relaxed social 
atmosphere, which we strive to keep hospitable to players 
both new and old to mudding. We spent almost a year 
overhauling things prior to going public in December of 
1997, and continue to aggressively enhance gameplay with 
original code and areas. While we will always be evolving 
and improving, we are focused on stability and balance. 
There will be no player wipes - ever!

Extensive remort system.  New PKill Grade system.

Coming soon - R6

Description :

 
             ***  Warning: Adult Content  ***

 This is a open minded 'yiffy' talker. There is not yet a 
very adequate fighting system though I am looking for a
coder who might be willing to help with such. This chat
is for herps (dragons and reptiles), furries, zoos, plush,
and related fandoms. If you do not know what any of these
mean, then you will most likely not like it there. In 
addition, the large portion of our user base is bisexual.
The talker is not overcrowded, and is mainly for talking to
friends in the same groups as you and yiffing in private or
public, and there are relatively few rules besides 'no 
humans allowed' and don't intentionally piss anyone off.
Note: All commands start with a . (thus who would be .who 
instead)  If you use Zmud, you must change the setting of
movement characters so that it will allow you to put a dot
before commands.

Mud         : X-Men: Mythologies
Code Base   : [MUX] TinyMUX
Telnet      : xmyth.pyramai.net 4201 [216.194.67.100]
WWW         : http://www.geocities.com/xmythologies/
Description :

 X-Men Mythologies is an X-Men/Marvel Comics themed game centered around 
the fabled students of Professor Charles Xavier. Unlike most other X-MU*'s 
(as they are so fondly called), X-Men Mythologies has five total playable
'worlds' in which to choose from once you've applied for a character. 
The cutoff date for the Mainstream world is about the time of 'Legion Quest'
(And the Age of Apocalypse). Non X-Men characters *are* permitted, as long 
as they are from a Marvel Comic. As well Non Feature/Orginal characters
are welcome, but must be Earth-based and not cosmic powered Mutants. 

The other four worlds outside of the Mainstream world are: 
Days of Future Past - A dark future where mutants are
hunted and killed or placed into concentration camps by
the massive Sentinel robots that dominate America.

The Age of Apocalypse - The High Lord Apocalypse rules
America in this alternate reality and mutants reign 
supreme through his 'survival of the fittest' dogma.

Medieval Utopia - A completely original and invented 
medieval fantasy setting. 

Millennium - Somewhat like a 'Year One' theme (for you DC
fans), the Millennium world is not unlike the X-Men 
Evolution cartoon. Note, however, that it is *not* an 
X-Men: Evolutions world. Closer to the short run/limited 
Children of the Atom comic.

Mud         : Ashavar's Legacy
Code Base   : [Dikumud] Judy
Telnet      : ashavar.com 2150 [207.206.185.83]
WWW         : http://www.ashavar.com/
Description :

  Ashavar's Legacy is a mud that is challenging and realistic while still being
a lot of fun.  Its focus is more on using your brain than pure hack and slash,
player killing, or role-playing.  There are puzzles built into the game and
randomized quests available.  Players can ask most humanoid mobiles questions
about how to find stores, guildmasters, or puzzle hints.

  This mud uses a race-less and class-less system.  The players choices of
stats determines what spells and skills he or she can learn.  Players can
increase their spells or skills by using them, instead of spending practice
sessions.  Players can also learn skills like mining, wood working, and
leather working so that they can forge their own equipment.  They can find
gems to give bonuses to forged items, runes to make their weapons cast
spells during combat, and glyphs to give their shields protection from a spell.

  There are also many client-like features built right into the mud, for
example aliases, autoactions, and some very advanced wimpy commands.  Other
unique features include specialized containers, a dress command that can
calculate the best equipment in your inventory and wear it, and the ability
to study a given room, then teleport to it later.  We also offer a free client
on our web page.

Mud         : ZombieMUD
Code Base   : [LP] LPMUD Driver, Zombie Lib
Telnet      : zombiemud.org 23 [213.139.166.106]
WWW         : http://zombiemud.org/
Description :


Since 1994, ZombieMUD has been on-line and bringing orc-butchering
fun to the masses from our home base in Oulu, Finland. We're a pretty
friendly bunch, with well over 100 players at any given time logging
in from all over the globe to test their skill in our medieval 
role-playing environment.

Like freedom? With fifteen guilds and thrice a dozen races to choose
from, you can play any sort of character you wish. Should you become
tired of one class, then have no fear, simply take a near painless
reincarnation and start your life with us anew without losing all
your precious experience gained in the past. Your choices are near
endless, and you can even play a character as odd as a mage-fighter
if you desire. In the end, we leave it up to you.

Love to collect? On ZombieMUD you are given the opportunity to build
and customize your own personal and permanant castle. Within its 
stone walls you may hoard chest upon chest of goodies, gathered from
througout the realm. You may even amass your own standing army to
defend your castle from wiley intruders.

Want quests? We've got them. Well over 200 various quests and
specially designed 'Equipment mobs' stand ready to challenge your
skill in battle with more tricks than Houdini himself. Hate quests?
That's fine too, as while doing quests will lessen level costs,
they are absolutely not required for advancement within the game.

Enjoy interaction? On ZombieMUD we love to party. Fightin' and
Killin' being specialties of ours most enjoyed in mass. While
fighting solo is a staple of some player's diets, others enjoy the
thrill of the group hunt. During a party you team your skills with
the skills of other guilds to bring down foes of legendary size and
strength. Whether you're a soloer or one who loves to interact, you
will find your niche here.

Admire progress? ZombieMUD has been continuously growing and changing
for over a decade, and it shows. Our lands are vast and our treasures
varied. Our staff is active and attentive to the mud itself,
constantly adding new areas, or improving the old to be certain
that Zombie and its players always have something new to discover.

Dare to begin? Check out our webpages and read up on the information 
listed there for new players. Join us at zombiemud.org, and see for 
yourself what all the fuss is really about.

Empire at a certain time, relations between the two empires could be warlike. Since we provide fully working ships to the empires, space battles between ships is a real possibility. If you have logged in, and are playing, and 
wonder why you do not see any other empires using 'who', thats because you only see your own empire. As for ships, they have phasers, photons, shields, relicators and even a working EMH to heal awayteams. You move in space until

the players. Well maybe I have two wishes, but Seven of Nine would probably break my neck if she knew my second wish. Anyways, give us a try, you just might as Spock would say, find us 'fascinating'.
